book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 1 - (Sahih) The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'I am but a gifted mercy.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 2 - (Hasan) Hadith: 'What Allah has made lawful in His Book is lawful, and what He has forbidden is unlawful, and what He has remained silent about is a pardon; so accept from Allah His pardon, for Allah was not to be forgetful of anything,' and he recited: {And your Lord is never forgetful} [Maryam: 64].

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 3 - (Da'if) And from Salman Al-Farsi: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ was asked about ghee, cheese, and fur. He said: 'The lawful is what Allah has made lawful in His Book, and the unlawful is what Allah has made unlawful in His Book, and what He has remained silent about is among that which He has pardoned for you.' Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and Ibn Majah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 4 - (Da'if) He ﷺ said: 'Verily Allah has enjoined obligations, so do not neglect them; and He has set limits, so do not transgress them; and He has forbidden things, so do not violate them; and He has remained silent about things as a mercy to you, not out of forgetfulness, so do not search for them.' (Narrated by Al-Daraqutni and Al-Nawawi classified it as Hasan, but it is Da'if/Weak).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 5 - (Sahih) 'Whoever introduces into this matter of ours (Islam) that which is not part of it, it is rejected.' Agreed upon.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 6 - (Hasan) Adi bin Hatim came to the Prophet ﷺ, and he had professed Christianity before Islam. When he heard the Prophet ﷺ reciting this verse: {They have taken their scholars and monks as lords besides Allah, and [also] the Messiah, the son of Mary. And they were not commanded except to worship one God; there is no deity except Him. Exalted is He above whatever they associate with Him} [At-Tawbah: 31], he said: 'O Messenger of Allah, they did not worship them.' He ﷺ said: 'Yes they did. They forbade the lawful for them and made the unlawful lawful for them, and they followed them; that is their worship of them.' Reported by Al-Tirmidhi and others, and he classified it as Hasan. In a narration, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said in interpretation of this verse: 'Nay, they did not worship them, but when they made something lawful for them, they considered it lawful, and when they made something unlawful for them, they considered it unlawful.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 7 - (Sahih) He ﷺ said: 'Perished are the extremists (who go to extremes in speech and scrupulousness)! Perished are the extremists! Perished are the extremists!' Narrated by Muslim, Ahmad, and Abu Dawood.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 8 - (Da'if) He ﷺ said: 'I was sent with the tolerant Hanifiyyah (monotheism).' Narrated by Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 9 - (Da'if) The Prophet ﷺ mentioned in what he narrates from his Lord, Blessed and Exalted, that He said: 'I created My servants as Hunafa (inclined to true faith), but the devils came to them and turned them away from their religion, and forbade upon them what I had made lawful for them, and commanded them to associate with Me that for which I had sent down no authority.' Narrated by Muslim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 10 - (Hasan) The Hadith of the Prophet ﷺ who said: 'Beware of the three acts that provoke cursing (i.e., that bring the curse of Allah and people upon the doer): Defecating in water sources, on the thoroughfare, and in the shade.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 11 - (Da'if) He (peace be upon him) said: 'Do not commit what the Jews committed, by making lawful the prohibitions of Allah through the slightest of tricks.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 12 - (Sahih) Hadith: 'A group of my Ummah will certainly make intoxicants (alcohol) lawful, calling them by other than their names.' Narrated by Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 13 - (Da'if) Hadith: 'A time will come upon people when they will make usury lawful under the name of trade.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 14 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Actions are but by intentions, and every person shall have what he intended.' Narrated by the two Sheikhs (Bukhari and Muslim) and others from the Hadith of Umar bin Al-Khattab in a Marfu' form, and it is a famous Hadith.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 15 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ said: 'And in the sexual intercourse of one of you there is charity.' They said: 'O Messenger of Allah, does one of us fulfill his desire and get a reward for it?' He said: 'Do you not see that if he were to fulfill it in a forbidden manner, there would be a burden of sin upon him? Likewise, if he fulfills it in a lawful manner, he has a reward.' Narrated by the two Sheikhs, and it is from the Hadith of Abu Dharr (RA): That some people from the Companions of the Prophet ﷺ said to the Prophet ﷺ: 'O Messenger of Allah, the wealthy have gone with the rewards; they pray as we pray, they fast as we fast, and they give charity from the surplus of their wealth.' He said: 'Has not Allah made for you that which you can give in charity? Verily, in every Tasbih (saying Subhan Allah) there is charity, and every Takbir (saying Allahu Akbar) is charity, and every Tahmid (saying Alhamdulillah) is charity, and every Tahlil (saying La ilaha illa Allah) is charity, and enjoining good is charity, and forbidding evil is charity, and in the sexual intercourse of one of you there is charity...' The rest is similar to what preceded, except that he said: 'Do you not see if he placed it...' Narrated by Muslim, Abu Dawood, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 16 - (Da'if) Hadith: 'Whoever seeks the world lawfully, refraining from begging, striving for his family, and showing kindness to his neighbor, will meet Allah with his face like the moon on the night of the full moon.' Narrated by At-Tabarani.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 17 - (Hasan) He ﷺ said: 'Verily Allah is Good and accepts nothing but good. And verily Allah commanded the believers with what He commanded the Messengers. He said: {O messengers, eat from the good foods and work righteousness. Indeed, I, of what you do, am Knowing} [Al-Mu'minun: 51], and He said: {O you who have believed, eat from the good things which We have provided for you} [Al-Baqarah: 172].' Then he mentioned a man who travels for a long time, disheveled and dusty (striving for Hajj, Umrah, and the like), extending his hands to the sky saying: 'O Lord, O Lord,' while his food is unlawful, his drink is unlawful, his clothing is unlawful, and he has been nourished with the unlawful, so how can he be answered?' Narrated by Muslim and Al-Tirmidhi from Abu Hurairah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 18 - (Da'if) 'Whoever collects wealth from Haram (unlawful sources) then gives it in charity, he will have no reward for it, and the burden of sin will be upon him.' Narrated by Ibn Khuzaimah, Ibn Hibban, and Al-Hakim from Abu Hurairah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 19 - (Da'if) 'A servant does not earn unlawful wealth and give charity from it such that it is accepted from him, nor does he spend from it such that it is blessed for him, nor does he leave it behind his back except that it will be his provision to the Fire. Verily, Allah does not erase the bad with the bad, but He erases the bad with the good. Verily, the impurity does not erase the impurity.' Ahmad and others from Ibn Mas'ud.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 20 - (Sahih) The Messenger (peace and blessings be upon him) said: 'The lawful is clear and the unlawful is clear, and between them are ambiguous matters which many people do not know (whether they are lawful or unlawful). So whoever avoids these doubtful matters has absolved his religion and his honor. And whoever falls into the doubtful matters falls into the unlawful, like the shepherd who pastures around a sanctuary (a reserved area defined by a ruler for his cattle alone, forbidding others from it); he is on the verge of pasturing inside it. Beware! Every king has a sanctuary, and the sanctuary of Allah is His prohibitions.' Narrated by the two Sheikhs and others from An-Nu'man bin Bashir, and the wording here is from the narration of Al-Tirmidhi.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 21 - (Sahih) 'By Allah, if Fatimah the daughter of Muhammad were to steal, I would have cut off her hand.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 22 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ was asked about sea water. He said: 'Its water is purifying and its dead animals are lawful.' Narrated by Ahmad and the authors of the Sunan.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 23 - (Sahih) And in the two Sahihs from Jabir (RA): That the Prophet ﷺ sent a military expedition of his Companions, and they found a large fish (whale) that the sea had thrown up (i.e., dead). They ate from it for twenty-odd days. Then they returned to Medina and informed the Messenger (peace be upon him), and he said: 'Eat, it is provision that Allah brought out for you. Feed us if you have any with you.' So some of them brought him a piece, and he ate it.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 24 - (Sahih) Ibn Abi Awfa (RA) said: 'We fought seven battles with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ eating locusts with him.' Narrated by the Group except Ibn Majah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 25 - (Sahih) From Ibn Abbas who said: A sheep was given in charity to a freed slave woman of Maimunah, the Mother of the Believers. It died, and the Messenger of Allah ﷺ passed by it and said: 'Why did you not take its hide (skin) and tan it so you could benefit from it?' They said: 'It is dead meat (carrion).' He ﷺ said: 'Only eating it has been made unlawful.' Narrated by the Group except Ibn Majah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 26 - (Sahih) 'Tanning of the hide (skin) is its purification (slaughter).' Narrated by Abu Dawood, Al-Nasa'i, Al-Daraqutni, Ahmad, Al-Hakim, and Al-Bayhaqi. The wording of Al-Nasa'i is: The Prophet of Allah ﷺ, during the expedition of Tabuk, asked for water from a woman. She said: 'I have nothing but a skin of a dead animal.' He said: 'Did you not tan it?' She said: 'Yes.' He said: 'Then its tanning is its purification.' Abu Dawood said: 'Its tanning is its purity,' and Ahmad added: 'or its slaughter.' In another narration: 'The slaughter of the hide is its tanning.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 27 - (Da'if) 'Its tanning removes its impurity.' Al-Hakim, weak with this wording.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 28 - (Sahih) 'Any hide that is tanned has become pure.' And in another wording: 'If the hide is tanned, it becomes pure.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 29 - (Sahih) And from Sawdah, the Mother of the Believers, she said: 'A sheep of ours died, so we tanned its skin, then we continued to make Nabidh in it (put dates in it to sweeten the water) until it became an old waterskin.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari and others.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 30 - (Sahih) 'Verily, Allah has not placed your cure in what He has forbidden to you.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari from Ibn Mas'ud; Sahih as a Mawquf narration.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 31 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ granted a concession for wearing silk to Abdur-Rahman bin Awf and Az-Zubayr bin Al-Awwam, may Allah be pleased with them both, because of an itch (scabies) they suffered from, despite his prohibition of wearing silk and his threat against it.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 32 - (Sahih) He (peace be upon him) forbade the eating of domestic donkeys on the day of Khaybar. Narrated by the two Sheikhs and others from the Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah. Benefit: What has been said that the prohibition of donkeys was for a temporary reason, such as their need to ride them at that time, is false even if there is no evidence, for the Hadith of Anas regarding the Prophet ﷺ says: 'Verily, Allah and His Messenger forbid you from the flesh of donkeys, for they are Rijs (abomination).' This is the reason explicitly stated, and it necessitates eternal prohibition by the Lawgiver.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 33 - (Sahih) It is narrated in the two Sahihs that he forbade eating every beast of prey with fangs and every bird with talons.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 34 - (Da'if) From Adi bin Hatim At-Ta'i, who said: I said, 'O Messenger of Allah, we hunt game but we do not find a knife, only a sharp stone (or sharp dry mud) and a splinter of a stick (i.e., reed).' He said: 'Cause the blood to flow with whatever you wish and mention the name of Allah over it.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 35 - (Sahih) And in the two Sahihs from Rafi' bin Khadij who said: 'We were with the Prophet ﷺ on a journey, and a camel from the people's camels fled. They did not have horses with them, so a man shot it with an arrow and restrained it. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Verily, these animals have a wild nature like wild beasts, so whatever of them does this to you, treat it in this way.'' Narrated by the two Sheikhs, the authors of the Sunan, and others.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 36 - (Sahih) And the Messenger ﷺ says: 'Whatever causes the blood to flow and the name of Allah is mentioned over it, then eat.' Narrated by the two Sheikhs and others from the Hadith of Tha'labah Al-Khushani.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 37 - (Sahih) And in Sahih Al-Bukhari from Aisha: That a people who were new to Islam said to the Prophet ﷺ: 'People bring us meat, and we do not know whether they mentioned the name of Allah over it or not. Should we eat from it or not?' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Mention the name of Allah yourselves and eat.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 38 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ ordered the sharpening of the blade and comforting the slaughtered animal: 'Verily Allah has prescribed excellence (Ihsan) in all things. So if you kill, kill well; and if you slaughter, slaughter well. Let one of you sharpen his blade and let him comfort his slaughtered animal.' Narrated by Muslim, the four Sunan authors, and others from Shaddad bin Aws.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 39 - (Da'if) From Ibn Umar: The Prophet ﷺ ordered that blades be sharpened and that they be hidden from the animals. And he said: 'If one of you slaughters, let him finish it quickly' (i.e., hasten the death). Narrated by Ibn Majah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 40 - (Sahih) From Ibn Abbas: A man laid down a sheep while sharpening his blade. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Do you want to kill it multiple times? Why did you not sharpen your blade before laying it down?' Narrated by Al-Hakim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 41 - (Hasan) 'Whatever is cut from an animal while it is alive is carrion (dead meat).' Narrated by Ahmad, Abu Dawood, Al-Tirmidhi, Al-Darimi, Al-Daraqutni, Al-Hakim, and Al-Bayhaqi from Abu Waqid Al-Laithi (RA) who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ arrived in Medina while people were cutting off the humps of camels and the buttocks of sheep. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said... [then he mentioned the Hadith].

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 42 - (Sahih) Abu Darda (RA) was asked about a ram slaughtered for a church called Jirjis, which was gifted to it: 'Should we eat from it?' Abu Darda said to the questioner: 'O Allah, pardon! They are but People of the Book; their food is lawful for us and our food is lawful for them.' And he ordered him to eat it. Narrated by At-Tabari in his Tafsir.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 43 - (Da'if) Because the Prophet ﷺ said: 'Treat them [the Zoroastrians] as you treat the People of the Book.' Narrated by Malik and Al-Shafi'i. As for what was reported as a completion to this Hadith, 'without marrying their women or eating their slaughtered meat,' it is not authentic according to the scholars of Hadith.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 44 - (Sahih) Hadith: That he ﷺ accepted the Jizya (tax) from the Magians (Zoroastrians) of Hajar. This is from the Hadith of Bajalah bin Abdah who said: 'Umar did not take the Jizya from the Magians until Abdur-Rahman bin Awf testified that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ took it from the Magians of Hajar.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Abu Dawood, Al-Nasa'i, and Al-Tirmidhi.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 45 - (Sahih) That a group asked the Prophet ﷺ saying: 'A people bring us meat, and we do not know whether they mentioned the name of Allah over it or not.' He (peace be upon him) said: 'Name Allah over it yourselves and eat.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 46 - (Da'if) 'Whoever kills a sparrow in vain, it will cry out to Allah on the Day of Resurrection saying: O Lord, so-and-so killed me in vain and did not kill me for any benefit.' Narrated by Al-Nasa'i, Ibn Hibban, Ahmad, and Al-Baghawi.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 47 - (Da'if) 'There is no human who kills a sparrow or anything larger without its right, except that Allah will ask him about it on the Day of Resurrection.' It was said: 'O Messenger of Allah, what is its right?' He said: 'That he slaughters it and eats it, and does not cut off its head and throw it away.' Narrated by Al-Nasa'i and Al-Hakim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 48 - (Sahih) And in the two Sahihs: 'If you send your dog and mention the name of Allah over it, and it catches [game] for you, and you reach it while it is alive, then slaughter it.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari and Muslim (the wording is his), Al-Nasa'i, and Ahmad from the Hadith of Adi bin Hatim who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to me... [he mentioned the Hadith and added]: 'And if you reach it after it has been killed and he did not eat from it, then eat. But if you find another dog with your dog and it has been killed, do not eat, for you do not know which of them killed it. And if you shoot your arrow and mention the name of Allah, and it disappears from you for a day and you find nothing on it but the mark of your arrow, then eat if you wish. But if you find it drowned in water, do not eat.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 49 - (Sahih) Adi bin Hatim asked the Prophet ﷺ saying: 'I hunt game with the Mi'rad (a hunting stick).' He said: 'If you throw the Mi'rad and it pierces (penetrates the body), then eat; but whatever it hits with its broad side (killing by blunt force), do not eat.' The Hadith is agreed upon, and it was also narrated by the authors of the Sunan except Ibn Majah, and others.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 50 - (Da'if) 'Do not eat from [what is killed by] the clay pellet unless you slaughter it [while alive].' Narrated by Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 51 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ forbade Al-Khadhf (throwing pebbles between two fingers) and said: 'It does not hunt game nor does it hurt the enemy, but it breaks the tooth and gouges the eye.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawood, Al-Nasa'i, Al-Darimi, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 52 - (Sahih) 'If you send the dog and it eats from the catch, do not eat, for it only caught it for itself. But if you send it and it kills without eating, then eat, for it caught it for its master.' Narrated by Ahmad (I [Albani] did not see it in Ahmad's Musnad with this wording, but its meaning is in Bukhari and Muslim and others from the Hadith of Adi bin Hatim who said: I asked the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: 'We are a people who hunt with these dogs.' He said: 'If you send your trained dogs and mention the name of Allah, then eat from what they catch for you, even if they kill it, unless the dog eats from it, for I fear that it only caught it for itself. And if other dogs mix with them, do not eat.')

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 53 - (Sahih) Adi bin Hatim asked the Prophet ﷺ saying: "I send my dog, but I find another dog with it, and I do not know which of them caught it." The Prophet ﷺ said: "Do not eat, for you only mentioned Allah's name over your dog and did not mention it over the other." Recorded by the Two Sheikhs (Bukhari and Muslim) and others.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 54 - (Sahih) Narrated by Adi bin Hatim, he said: I asked the Messenger of Allah ﷺ about hunting. He said: "If you shoot your arrow and find it [the game] killed, then eat, unless you find that it has fallen into water, for you do not know if the water killed it or your arrow." Recorded by the Two Sheikhs and others. He added after saying "your arrow": "So mention the name of Allah." Bukhari does not include the phrase "for you do not know".

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 55 - (Sahih) Narrated by Adi bin Hatim: I said: "O Messenger of Allah, I shoot game and find my arrow in it the next day." He said: "If you know that your arrow killed it and you do not see the mark of a predator on it, then eat." Recorded by At-Tirmidhi, An-Nasa'i, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 56 - (Sahih) And in Sahih Muslim, the Prophet ﷺ said to Abu Tha'labah Al-Khushani: "If you shoot your arrow and it [the game] disappears for three days, and then you find it, eat it as long as it has not decayed." Recorded by Muslim, An-Nasa'i, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 57 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ was asked about drinks made from honey or from corn and barley that are fermented until they become strong. The Prophet ﷺ had been given the comprehensive speech (Jawami' al-Kalim), so he replied with a comprehensive answer: "Every intoxicant is Khamr (wine), and every Khamr is forbidden." Recorded by Muslim. It is composed of two hadiths: The first from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ sent me and Mu'adh to Yemen and said: "Invite the people, give glad tidings and do not repel, make things easy and do not make them difficult." I said: "O Messenger of Allah, give us a ruling regarding two drinks we used to make in Yemen: Al-Bit' (mead), which is made from honey and fermented until strong, and Al-Mizr (beer), made from corn and barley and fermented until strong." He said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ had been given comprehensive speech along with its conclusions, so he said: "I forbid every intoxicant that distracts from prayer." Recorded by Muslim and Ahmad briefly with the wording "Every intoxicant is forbidden." The other is from Abdullah bin Umar from the Prophet ﷺ who said: "Every intoxicant is Khamr, and every Khamr is forbidden." Recorded by Muslim, the authors of the Sunan, others, and Ahmad. He said it is a Sahih Hadith, and At-Tirmidhi said it is a Hasan Sahih Hadith.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 58 - (Sahih) The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Whatever intoxicates in large amounts, a small amount of it is forbidden." Recorded by Ahmad, Abu Dawood, and At-Tirmidhi.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 59 - (Sahih) "Whatever intoxicates in a Faraq (a large measure), a handful of it is forbidden." Recorded by Ahmad, Abu Dawood, and At-Tirmidhi.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 60 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ cursed ten people regarding Khamr (wine): The one who presses it, the one for whom it is pressed (who requests it), the one who drinks it, the one who carries it, the one to whom it is carried, the one who pours it, the one who sells it, the one who consumes its price, the one who buys it, and the one for whom it is bought. Recorded by At-Tirmidhi and Ibn Majah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 61 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ said: "Indeed Allah has forbidden Khamr. So whoever this verse reaches while he has any of it, let him not drink it nor sell it." The narrator of the Hadith said: So the people took what they had of it to the streets of Medina and poured it out. Recorded by Muslim from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ giving a sermon in Medina saying: "O people, indeed Allah implies regarding Khamr, and perhaps Allah will reveal a command regarding it. So whoever has any of it, let him sell it and benefit from it." He said: We waited only a short while until the Prophet ﷺ said... and he mentioned it.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 62 - (Very Weak) "Whoever holds back grapes during the harvest days to sell them to a Jew—meaning for a Jew—or a Christian, or to one who makes it into Khamr—meaning even if he is a Muslim—has plunged into the Fire with clear knowledge." Recorded by At-Tabarani in Al-Awsat, and Al-Hafiz declared it Hasan in Bulugh Al-Maram, but it is very weak, and Al-Hafiz's classification of it as Hasan is an error, and I do not know its origin. (See the rest of the explanation).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 63 - (Weak) It was narrated that a man wanted to gift the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, a skin of wine. The Prophet informed him that Allah had forbidden it. The man said: "Shall I not sell it?" The Prophet said: "Indeed He who forbade drinking it forbade selling it." The man said: "Shall I not honor the Jews with it?" The Prophet said: "Indeed He who forbade it forbade honoring the Jews with it." The man said: "Then what should I do with it?" The Prophet ﷺ said: "Pour it out on the Batha (valley floor)." Recorded by Al-Humaydi in the Musnad; its chain is weak. The authentic version is the Hadith of Ibn Abbas who said: A man gifted the Messenger of Allah ﷺ a skin of wine. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to him: "Did you know that Allah has forbidden it?" He said: "No." Then he whispered to a person. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ asked him: "What did you whisper to him?" He said: "I ordered him to sell it." He said: "Indeed He who forbade drinking it forbade selling it." He said: So he opened the skin until what was in it was gone. Recorded by Muslim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 64 - (Sahih) Narrated by Umar (may Allah be pleased with him): I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say: "Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him not sit at a table where Khamr is being circulated." Recorded by Ahmad, and its meaning is found in At-Tirmidhi (Sahih) Al-Irwa 1949.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 65 - (Sahih) What the Messenger ﷺ answered regarding it: A man asked him about Khamr and he forbade him from it. The man said: "I only make it for medicine." The Prophet ﷺ said: "It is not a medicine, but it is a disease." Recorded by Muslim, Ahmad, Abu Dawood, At-Tirmidhi, and Ibn Majah from Wa'il Al-Hadrami.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 66 - (Weak) "Indeed Allah sent down the disease and the cure, and He made a cure for every disease. So treat yourselves, but do not treat yourselves with something forbidden." Recorded by Abu Dawood.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 67 - (Sahih) Ibn Mas'ud said regarding intoxicants: "Indeed Allah did not place your cure in what He forbade for you."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 68 - (Sahih) And the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "There should be no harming and no reciprocating harm." Recorded by Ahmad and Ibn Majah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 69 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ forbade the wasting of wealth. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Ad-Darimi, and Ahmad from the Hadith of Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah who said: "He ﷺ used to forbid 'it was said' and 'he said' (gossip), asking too many questions, and wasting wealth. And he used to forbid disobedience to mothers, burying daughters alive, and withholding and demanding (stinginess and begging)." And Muslim recorded it from him as a Marfu' narration with the wording: "Indeed Allah Almighty has forbidden for you disobedience to mothers, burying daughters alive, and withholding and demanding; and He disliked for you three things: 'it was said' and 'he said', asking too many questions, and wasting wealth." This is also a narration of Al-Bukhari and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 70 - (Hasan) Narrated by Bahz bin Hakim, from his father, from his grandfather, who said: I said: "O Messenger of Allah, regarding our Awrah (private parts), what should we conceal and what may we leave uncovered?" He said: "Guard your Awrah except from your wife or what your right hand possesses." I said: "O Messenger of Allah, what if people are mixed together (i.e., in travel etc.)?" He said: "If you can ensure that no one sees it, then do not let anyone see it." I said: "What if one of us is alone (i.e., by himself)?" He said: "Allah, Blessed and Almighty, is more deserving that you be shy of Him." Recorded by Ahmad, Abu Dawood, At-Tirmidhi, Ibn Majah, Al-Hakim, and Al-Bayhaqi. (See also Record No. 353, or Ghayat al-Maram Hadith 70).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 71 - (Weak) "Cleanse yourselves, for Islam is clean." Recorded by Ibn Hibban in 'Al-Du'afa' (The Weak Narrators) from the Hadith of Aisha.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 72 - (Very Weak) "Cleanliness invites to faith, and faith is with its owner in Paradise." Recorded by At-Tabarani in Al-Awsat with a very weak chain.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 73 - (Weak) A man came to the Prophet with disheveled hair and beard. The Messenger signaled to him as if ordering him to groom his hair. He did so and then returned. The Prophet ﷺ said: "Is this not better than one of you coming with disheveled hair as if he were a devil?" Weak with this wording; recorded by Malik in Al-Muwatta. The Hadith following it suffices instead of it.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 74 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ saw a man with disheveled hair and said: "Could this man not find something to calm his hair?" And he saw another wearing dirty clothes and said: "Could this man not find something to wash his garment with?" Recorded by Abu Dawood.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 75 - (Sahih) A man came to him ﷺ wearing a low-quality garment. He said to him: "Do you have wealth?" He said: "Yes." He asked: "From what kind of wealth?" He said: "From all kinds of wealth; Allah Almighty has given me." He said: "Since Allah has given you wealth, let the effect of Allah's blessing and generosity upon you be seen." Recorded by An-Nasa'i, Abu Dawood, Al-Hakim, Ahmad, Ibn Sa'd, and Al-Harbi. And in the narration of Ahmad: "Indeed, when Allah Almighty bestows a blessing upon a servant, He loves that it be seen on him." It has a witness in At-Tirmidhi with the wording: "Indeed Allah loves to see the effect of His blessing upon His servant."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 76 - (Sahih) He said: "There is no harm on any of you—if he finds the means—to adopt two garments for Friday other than his work clothes." Recorded by Abu Dawood.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 77 - (Sahih) Narrated by Ali, may Allah honor his face: The Prophet ﷺ took silk and placed it in his right hand, and took gold and placed it in his left, then said: "Indeed, these two are forbidden for the males of my Ummah." Recorded by Ahmad, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, Ibn Hibban, and Ibn Majah. Ibn Majah added: "Permitted for their females." It has a witness from the Hadith of Abu Musa that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Gold and silk have been permitted for the females of my Ummah and forbidden for its males."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 78 - (Sahih) Narrated by Umar: I heard the Prophet ﷺ say: "Do not wear silk, for whoever wears it in this world will not wear it in the Hereafter." Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 79 - (Sahih) He ﷺ said regarding a silk suit: "This is only the clothing of one who has no share [in the Hereafter]." Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad from the Hadith of Umar, may Allah be pleased with him.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 80 - (Sahih) He saw a gold ring on a man's hand, so he removed it and threw it away, saying: "Does one of you intentionally take a live coal from the fire and place it in his hand?" It was said to the man after the Messenger of Allah ﷺ had left: "Take your ring and benefit from it." He said: "No, by Allah, I will not take it after the Messenger of Allah ﷺ threw it away." Recorded by Muslim and others from the Hadith of Ibn Abbas.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 81 - (Sahih) Al-Bukhari narrated from Ibn Umar who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ took a ring of silver (Wariq) and it was on his hand, then it was later on the hand of Abu Bakr, then later on the hand of Umar, then later on the hand of Uthman, until it fell into the Well of Aris. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, as well as Muslim, Abu Dawood, Ahmad, and Al-Humaydi in his Musnad. They added at the end: "Its engraving was 'Muhammad Rasul Allah'."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 82 - (Sahih) In Sahih Al-Bukhari, the Prophet said to the man who wanted to marry the woman who offered herself: "Search, even for a ring of iron." This was recorded by the rest of the authors of the Sunan and others. There is no proof in this for the permissibility of wearing an iron ring, because the permission to acquire it does not necessitate the permission to wear it. The prohibition of it has been authenticated; Al-Bukhari recorded in Al-Adab Al-Mufrad and Ahmad from Amr bin Shu'ayb from his father from his grandfather that a man came to the Prophet ﷺ with a gold ring on his hand. The Prophet ﷺ turned away from him. When the man saw his dislike, he went and threw the ring away, then took an iron ring and wore it, and came to the Prophet ﷺ. He said: "This is worse; this is the jewelry of the people of the Fire." So he returned, threw it away, and wore a silver ring, and the Prophet ﷺ remained silent about it. Its chain is Jayyid Sahih (good authentic).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 83 - (Sahih) He (peace be upon him) permitted the wearing of it (silk) for Abdur-Rahman bin Awf and Az-Zubayr bin Al-Awwam, may Allah be pleased with them, due to an itch they suffered from. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, as well as Muslim, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, and Ahmad from the Hadith of Anas bin Malik who said: "The Prophet ﷺ granted a concession to Az-Zubayr and Abdur-Rahman to wear silk due to an itch they had." Muslim and Ahmad added in a narration "during travel". The wording of At-Tirmidhi, which is in a narration of Al-Bukhari, is that Abdur-Rahman bin Awf and Az-Zubayr bin Al-Awwam complained of lice to the Prophet ﷺ during a military expedition, so he granted them a concession to wear silk shirts. He said: "And I saw it on them." At-Tirmidhi said it is a Hasan Sahih Hadith.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 84 - (Sahih) "Any woman who perfumes herself and passes by a group of people so that they may smell her scent is a Zaniyah (adulteress), and every eye is committing Zina." Recorded by An-Nasa'i, Al-Hakim, Ibn Khuzaymah and Ibn Hibban in their Sahihs, Abu Dawood, and At-Tirmidhi.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 85 - (Sahih) From Abu Hurayrah who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Two types of the people of the Fire I have not seen: People with whips like the tails of cattle with which they beat the people (a reference to unjust rulers who are enemies of the people), and women who are clothed yet naked, swaying and inclining others, their heads like the leaning humps of Bukht camels; they will not enter Paradise nor smell its fragrance, though its fragrance can be found from such and such distance."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 86 - (Sahih) From the Hadith of Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: "Allah cursed the man who wears the clothing of a woman, and the woman who wears the clothing of a man." Recorded by Ahmad, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, Ibn Majah, Ibn Hibban, and Al-Hakim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 87 - (Sahih) "And he cursed the men who imitate women and the women who imitate men." Recorded by Al-Bukhari and others.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 88 - (Weak) "Four are cursed in this world and the Hereafter, and the Angels say Amen: A man whom Allah made male but he makes himself female and imitates women; a woman whom Allah made female but she makes herself male and imitates men; the one who misleads a blind person; and a man who is celibate [Hasur], while Allah made no one Hasur except Yahya bin Zakariya." Recorded by At-Tabarani.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 89 - (Sahih) Narrated by Ali: "The Messenger of Allah ﷺ forbade me from wearing gold rings, from wearing Al-Qassi (a type of silk), and from wearing Al-Mu'asfar (garments dyed with safflower)." Recorded by Muslim, as well as Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, Ibn Majah (the last sentence of it), and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 90 - (Sahih) "Whoever drags his garment out of arrogance, Allah will not look at him on the Day of Resurrection." Agreed upon. It is from the Hadith of Abdullah bin Umar (may Allah be pleased with him). Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, and Ibn Majah, as well as Malik and Ahmad through many paths from Ibn Umar. At-Tirmidhi said it is a Hasan Sahih Hadith. Al-Bukhari, An-Nasa'i, and Ahmad added in a narration: "Abu Bakr said: 'O Messenger of Allah, one side of my Izar (lower garment) slips down unless I pay attention to it.' The Prophet ﷺ said: 'You are not among those who do it out of arrogance.'" Ahmad added in a narration via Nafi', who said: Sulayman bin Yasar informed me that Umm Salamah mentioned women, so he said: "Let it down a handspan." She said: "Then they will be uncovered." He said: "Then a cubit, and let them not add to it."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 91 - (Sahih) "Whoever wears a garment of fame (vanity), Allah will clothe him in a garment of humiliation on the Day of Resurrection." Recorded by Ahmad, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, and Ibn Majah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 92 - (Hasan) A man asked Ibn Umar: "What clothes should I wear?" He said: "That which fools will not mock you for—meaning due to its triviality and poor appearance—and which the wise will not fault you for." Recorded by At-Tabarani. It appears in the book as 'Al-Hukama' (the Wise), but the correct word is 'Al-Hulama' (the Forbearing/Prudent).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 93 - (Sahih) The Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, cursed the woman who tattoos (Washima) and the one who gets tattooed (Mustawshima), and the one who files teeth (Washira) and the one who has them filed (Mustawshira). Recorded by Muslim. It is Sahih, but the phrase "Washira and Mustawshira" is not in Muslim. He recorded it, as did Al-Bukhari, from the Hadith of Abdullah bin Umar that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ cursed the woman who adds false hair (Wasilah) and the one who asks for it (Mustawsilah), and the Washima and Mustawshima. In a narration by Al-Bukhari: "Allah cursed the Wasilah..." Yes, this addition came from the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) via Masruq, that a woman came to Ibn Mas'ud and said: "I have been informed that you forbid the Wasilah." He said: "Yes." She said: "Is it something you find in the Book of Allah or did you hear it from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ?" He said: "I find it in the Book of Allah and from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ." She said: "By Allah, I have examined what is between the two covers of the Mushaf and I did not find what you say." He said: "Did you find in it: {And whatever the Messenger gives you, take it, and whatever he forbids you, abstain from it}?" She said: "Yes." He said: "Then indeed I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ forbid the Namisah (plucker), the Washira, the Wasilah, and the Washima, except for [treatment of] a disease." The woman said: "Perhaps it is in some of your womenfolk." He said to her: "Enter." So she entered and then came out and said: "I did not see any harm." He said: "Did you not memorize the testament of the Righteous Servant: {I do not wish to differ from you by doing that which I forbid you}?" Recorded by An-Nasa'i and Ahmad, and the context is his. Its chain is Sahih according to the condition of Muslim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 94 - (Sahih) 'Allah has cursed the women who do tattoos and those who ask for tattoos to be done, the women who pluck eyebrows (Namisat) and those who ask for eyebrows to be plucked (Mutanammisat), and the women who file their teeth for the purpose of beauty, those who change the creation of Allah.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari and Muslim from the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 94 - (Sahih) "Allah cursed the women who tattoo and those who get tattooed, the women who pluck facial hair (Namisat) and those who have it plucked (Mutanammisat), and those who file their teeth for beauty (Mutafallijat), changing the creation of Allah." Recorded by Al-Bukhari and Muslim from the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 95 - (Sahih) From Ibn Abbas who said: " The Wasilah (hair extender), the Mustawsilah, the Namisah, the Mutanammisah, the Washima, and the Mustawshima were cursed, [when done] without disease."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 96 - (Weak) At-Tabari narrated about the wife of Abu Ishaq that she entered upon Aisha, and she was a young woman who admired beauty. The woman said: "Can I remove hair from my forehead for my husband?" She said: "Remove the harm from yourself as much as you can." Fath al-Bari, explanation of the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud in the Chapter of Mutanammisat, Book of Clothing. Weak. See the explanation and summary: removing facial hair is not permissible, contrary to some Hanbalis.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 97 - (Sahih) Al-Bukhari and others narrated from Aisha, her sister Asma, Ibn Mas'ud, Ibn Umar, and Abu Hurayrah that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ cursed the Wasilah (hair extender) and the Mustawsilah (one asking for extensions).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 98 - (Sahih) From Aisha: An Ansari girl got married and she fell ill, causing her hair to fall out. They wanted to add extensions to it, so they asked the Prophet ﷺ. He said: "Allah cursed the Wasilah and the Mustawsilah." Recorded by Al-Bukhari, as well as Muslim, An-Nasa'i, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 99 - (Sahih) From Asma, who said: A woman asked the Prophet ﷺ saying: "O Messenger of Allah, my daughter was afflicted with measles and her hair fell out, and I have married her off. Shall I add extensions to it?" He said: "Allah cursed the Wasilah and the Mustawsilah." Recorded by Al-Bukhari, as well as Muslim and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 100 - (Sahih) From Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib who said: Mu'awiyah came to Medina for the last time, and he addressed us. He took out a bundle of hair and said: "I did not think anyone did this except the Jews. Indeed the Prophet ﷺ named it 'Falsehood' (Az-Zur)—meaning the woman who extends hair." In a narration, he said to the people of Medina: "Where are your scholars? I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ forbidding the likes of this and saying: 'The Children of Israel were only destroyed when their women adopted this.'" Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, An-Nasa'i, and Ahmad. See the explanation, which notes that joining hair with non-hair items like rags is included in the prohibition.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 101 - (Sahih) "Whoever cheats us is not one of us." Narrated by a group of the Companions in Muslim and others among the authors of Sunan and Musnads.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 102 - (Sahih) The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud with his saying: "...those who change the creation of Allah."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 103 - (Weak) From Sa'id bin Jubayr who said: "There is no harm in Al-Qaramil (hair ties/extensions of silk or wool)." Recorded by Abu Dawood. This Athar (narration), along with its weak chain, contradicts the Hadith of Mu'awiyah mentioned previously (No. 100), for in some authentic narrations from him, a man brought a stick with a rag on its end, and Mu'awiyah said: "Is this not Falsehood (Az-Zur)?" Qatadah said: "Meaning what women use to increase their hair made of rags." Recorded by Muslim and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 105 - (Sahih) When Abu Bakr As-Siddiq brought his father Abu Quhafah on the day of the Conquest of Mecca, carrying him until he placed him before the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and he saw his head looked like the Thaghamah plant in whiteness, he said: "Change this (meaning the grey hair) and avoid black." Recorded by Muslim, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 104 - (Sahih) From Abu Hurayrah, that he ﷺ said: "Indeed the Jews and Christians do not dye, so differ from them." Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 106 - (Weak) Az-Zuhri said: "We used to dye with black if the face was new (youthful), but when the face and teeth shook (aged), we abandoned it." Recorded by Ibn Abi Asim in 'Kitab Al-Khadab'. (See the explanation and discussion on the subject on p. 83; the summary is that there is no proof for permissibility, and he cited other hadiths proving the prohibition of black dye).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 107 - (Sahih) From Abu Dharr: "The best things with which you change grey hair are Henna and Katam." Recorded by Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, Ibn Majah, Ahmad, and Al-Khatib.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 108 - (Sahih) From Ibn Umar from the Prophet ﷺ who said: "Differ from the polytheists: grow the beards and trim the mustaches." Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, and others.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 109 - (Sahih) From Ibn Umar: "Whoever imitates a people is one of them." Recorded by Abu Dawood.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 110 - (Fabricated/Mawdu') At-Tirmidhi and others narrated from Abdullah bin Amr that the Prophet ﷺ used to trim from the length and breadth of his beard.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 111 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ used to say: "Four things are part of happiness: A righteous wife, a spacious dwelling, a righteous neighbor, and a comfortable mount." Recorded by Ibn Hibban from the Hadith of Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 112 - (Weak) An-Nasa'i informed us with his chain from Abu Mijlaz who said: Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) said: I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ while he was performing ablution, and I heard him say: "O Allah, forgive my sin, make my home spacious for me, and bless me in my provision." I said: "O Prophet of Allah, I heard you supplicating with such and such." He said: "Did it leave anything out?"

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 113 - (Weak) "Indeed Allah Almighty is Tayyib (Good) and loves goodness, Clean and loves cleanliness, Generous and loves generosity, Munificent and loves munificence. So clean your courtyards and do not imitate the Jews." Recorded by At-Tirmidhi and he weakened it.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 114 - (Sahih) The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "He who has a mustard seed's weight of arrogance in his heart shall not enter Paradise." A man said: "Indeed a man loves that his garment be nice and his sandals be nice." He ﷺ said: "Indeed Allah is Beautiful and loves beauty." Recorded by Muslim from the Hadith of Alqamah. He added at the end: "Arrogance is rejecting the truth and looking down on people." Recorded by Ahmad via Humayd bin Abdur-Rahman who said: Ibn Mas'ud said... so I came to him ﷺ and Malik bin Mararah Ar-Rahawi was with him. I caught the end of his speech as he was saying: "O Messenger of Allah, I have been allotted the beauty you see, and I do not like anyone from the people to surpass me even by a shoelace or more—is that arrogance?" He said: "That is not arrogance; rather, arrogance is rejecting the truth—or he said: ignoring the truth—and looking down on people."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 115 - (Sahih) And in a narration, a handsome man came to the Prophet ﷺ and said: "I love beauty, and I have been given what you see, such that I do not like anyone to surpass me by a sandal strap. Is that from arrogance, O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "No, but arrogance is rejecting the truth and despising people." Recorded by Abu Dawood from the Hadith of Abu Hurayrah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 116 - (Sahih) From Umm Salamah (may Allah be pleased with her): "He who eats in vessels of gold and silver is only dragging the fire of Hell into his belly." Recorded by Muslim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 117 - (Sahih) From Hudhayfah who said: "The Messenger of Allah ﷺ forbade us from drinking in vessels of gold and silver and from eating in them, and from wearing silk and Dibaj (brocade), and from sitting on it. He said: 'It is for them (the disbelievers) in this world, and for us in the Hereafter.'" Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, Ad-Darimi, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 118 - (Sahih) The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "The angels do not enter a house in which there are statues or images." Agreed upon (Mutafaq Alayh). The wording is attributed to Muslim. Al-Albani said: I did not see it with this exact wording in Muslim or others. The closest in Muslim is the Hadith of Abu Hurayrah who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "The angels do not enter a house in which there are statues or images." And the closest in At-Tirmidhi via Rafi' bin Ishaq who said: I and Abdullah bin Abi Talhah entered upon Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri to visit him when ill... so Abu Sa'id said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ informed us... and he mentioned it like the wording of the book except he said "...or an image"—Ishaq was unsure which one he said. And Ibn Majah recorded it from the Hadith of Ali (Marfu') with the wording: "in which there is a dog or an image." As for Al-Bukhari, he has hadiths with its meaning, including the Hadith of Salim from his father (Ibn Umar) who said: Gabriel promised the Prophet ﷺ, then said: "We do not enter a house in which there is an image or a dog." Recorded in his Sahih. And the Hadith of Ibn Abbas from Abu Talhah from the Prophet ﷺ who said: "The angels do not enter a house in which there is a dog or an image." Recorded by him and Ibn Majah; Al-Bukhari added in the second place: "Meaning the image of statues which have souls." Recorded by Muslim and others via another path from Abu Talhah. It will come under number 133. (Note): These hadiths and those with similar meanings coming in the book cover 3-dimensional images (statues) and non-3-dimensional ones. (See explanation).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 119 - (Sahih) He (peace be upon him) said: "Indeed, among the people most severely punished on the Day of Resurrection are those who make these images." And in a narration: "Those who imitate the creation of Allah." Agreed upon. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, An-Nasa'i, and Ahmad via paths from Az-Zuhri from Al-Qasim bin Muhammad bin Abi Bakr As-Siddiq from Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) who said: The Prophet ﷺ entered upon me while there was a curtain in the house with images on it. His face changed color, then he took the curtain and tore it. She said: The Prophet ﷺ said... and she mentioned it with the first wording which is Al-Bukhari's. The wording of Muslim and Ahmad is: "Those who imitate the creation of Allah." (See the rest of the explanation and other texts on p. 93 of the book).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 120 - (Sahih) And he (peace be upon him) informed that: "Whoever makes an image will be tasked on the Day of Resurrection to breathe the soul into it, and he will not be able to breathe into it ever." Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, An-Nasa'i, and Ahmad. Follow the explanation and other texts in the book, p. 94.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 121 - (Sahih) The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Indeed those who make these images will be punished on the Day of Resurrection. It will be said to them: 'Give life to what you created.'" Agreed upon. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, An-Nasa'i, and Ahmad. Nafi' has another chain for it; Malik said in Al-Muwatta from Nafi' from Al-Qasim bin Muhammad from Aisha, the wife of the Prophet ﷺ, that she bought a cushion with images on it. When the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saw it, he stood at the door and did not enter. She recognized disapproval in his face and said: "I repent to Allah and His Messenger! What sin have I committed?" The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "What is the matter with this cushion?" She said: "I bought it for you to sit on and recline on." The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Indeed the owners of these images will be punished on the Day of Resurrection. It will be said to them: 'Give life to what you created.'" Then he said: "Indeed the house in which there are images is not entered by the angels." In a narration by Al-Bukhari from her, she said: "I stuffed a pillow for the Prophet ﷺ which had statues (images) on it like a small cushion..." up to his saying: "Did you not know that the angels..." Ash-Shafi'i added: She said: "So he did not enter until I took it out." (This implies that the images were not 3-dimensional).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 122 - (Agreed Upon) From Abu Zur'ah who said: I entered with Abu Hurayrah into the house of Marwan and he saw images in it (and in a narration: he saw a maker making images in the house). He said: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say... narrating from Allah Almighty: "Who is more unjust than one who goes to create like My creation? Let them create an ant (or let them create a grain), let them create a barley corn." Agreed upon, and the context is from Muslim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 123 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ said: "Do not exaggerate in praising me as the Christians exaggerated in praising Jesus, son of Mary. Rather, say: The Slave of Allah and His Messenger." Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Ad-Darimi, and Ahmad from the Hadith of Ibn Abbas from Umar bin Al-Khattab.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 124 - (Weak) "Do not stand up as the foreigners (non-Arabs/Persians) stand up, glorifying one another." Weak. Recorded by Abu Dawood and Ibn Majah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 125 - (Sahih) From Abu Hurayrah who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Do not make your houses graveyards, and do not make my grave a place of festivity (Eid), and send blessings upon me, for your blessings reach me wherever you are." Recorded by Abu Dawood and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 126 - (Sahih) "O Allah, do not make my grave an idol to be worshipped." It is in Al-Muwatta from Ata'. Its verification is in 'Tahdhir As-Sajid' by Al-Albani.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 127 - (Sahih) People came to him ﷺ and said: "O Messenger of Allah, O best of us and son of the best of us, O our master and son of our master." He said: "O people, say what you say, and do not let Satan carry you away. I am Muhammad, the Slave of Allah and His Messenger. I do not like you to raise me above the status that Allah Almighty has placed me in." Recorded by Ahmad in the Musnad, Abd bin Humayd in 'Al-Muntakhab min Al-Musnad', Ibn Mandah in 'At-Tawhid', and Al-Diya' Al-Maqdisi in 'Al-Ahadith Al-Mukhtarah' via paths from Hammad bin Salamah from Thabit from Anas bin Malik.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 128 - (Agreed Upon) From the Mother of the Believers, Aisha, who said: "I used to play with dolls in the presence of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. I had friends who would play with me. When the Messenger of Allah ﷺ entered, they would hide from him, but he would send them to me so they could play with me." Agreed upon. Correct, but with the wording: "I used to play with dolls in the presence of the Prophet ﷺ and I had friends who played with me. When the Messenger of Allah ﷺ entered, they would hide from him, so he would send them (yusarribuhunna) to me to play with me." This is the wording in Al-Bukhari and Ahmad, and likewise Muslim, but he does not have "play with me". The phrase in the book "yusirru li-maji'ihinna" (he was pleased with their coming) is a misspelling of "yusarribuhunna" (he would send them).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 129 - (Sahih) From the Mother of the Believers, Aisha, in a narration: The Prophet ﷺ said to her one day: "What is this?" She said: "My dolls." He said: "What is this in the middle of them?" She said: "A horse." He said: "What is this on it?" She said: "Two wings." He said: "A horse with two wings?" She said: "Have you not heard that Solomon, son of David, had horses with wings?" The Messenger of Allah ﷺ laughed until his molars were visible. Recorded by Abu Dawood, and it is in 'Adab Az-Zafaf' by Al-Albani.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 130 - (Sahih) It was reported in the Hadith that Gabriel, peace be upon him, refrained from entering the house of the Messenger ﷺ due to the presence of a statue at the door of his house. He did not enter until the next day when he said to him: "Order the head of the statue to be cut off so it becomes like the shape of a tree."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 131 - (Sahih) Indeed, the people most severely punished are those who attempt to imitate the creation of Allah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 132 - (Sahih) Ibn Mas'ud said: I heard the Prophet ﷺ say: Indeed, the people most severely punished in the sight of Allah are the image-makers (Al-Musawwirun). Narrated by Muslim, An-Nasa'i, Ahmad, and Al-Humaydi, and from him Al-Bukhari in his Sahih.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 133 - (Sahih) From Busr bin Sa'id from Zaid ibn Khalid from Abu Talha, the companion of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'The Angels do not enter a house in which there is an image.' Busr said: Then Zaid fell ill afterwards, so we visited him, and behold, there was a curtain on his door with an image on it. I said to Ubaidullah Al-Khawlani, the stepson of Maimunah, the wife of the Prophet ﷺ (who was with him): 'Did Zaid not inform us about images the other day?' Ubaidullah said: 'Did you not hear him when he said: Except for a design in a fabric?' Narrated by Muslim, and likewise Al-Bukhari, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, Ahmad, and Ibn Majah (the Marfu' part only).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 134 - (Sahih) From Utbah, that he entered upon Abu Talha Al-Ansari to visit him (during illness), and he found Sahl bin Hunayf (another Companion) with him. He said: Abu Talha called a person to remove a carpet beneath him. Sahl said to him: 'Why do you remove it?' He said: 'Because there are images in it, and the Prophet ﷺ said regarding them what you already know.' Sahl said: 'Did he not say: Except for what is a design in a fabric?' Abu Talha said: 'Yes, but it is more pleasing to my soul.' Narrated by Malik in Al-Muwatta, and from him At-Tirmidhi, and likewise An-Nasa'i. Follow the beneficial explanation in the book by Al-Albani. From it, it is clarified that making images that cast a shadow and those that do not is strictly prohibited. As for possessing an object with images of animals: if it is hung on a wall, or is a worn garment or turban and the like which is not considered debased (trodden upon), it is prohibited. But if it is in a carpet that is stepped on, or a pillow or cushion and the like which is debased, it is not prohibited. And there is no difference in all of this between what has a shadow and what does not, as stated by An-Nawawi in the explanation of Muslim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 135 - (Sahih) Muslim narrated from Zaid bin Khalid Al-Juhani from Abu Talha Al-Ansari who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say: 'The Angels do not enter a house in which there is a dog or statues.' He said: So I went to Aisha and said: 'This one tells me that the Prophet ﷺ said: The Angels do not enter a house in which there is a dog or statues. Did you hear the Messenger of Allah ﷺ mention that?' She said: 'No... but I will tell you what I saw him do. I saw him leave for one of his expeditions, so I took a carpet (Namqt) and screened the door with it. When he arrived and saw the carpet, I recognized disapproval in his face. He pulled it (the carpet) until he tore it or cut it down and said: Indeed, Allah did not command us to clothe stone and clay.' She said: 'So we cut from it two pillows and stuffed them with palm fibers, and he did not criticize me for that.' It is Sahih except for Aisha's saying 'No', which is Shadh (anomalous) or Munkar (denounced). Follow the explanation in the book, for it is important.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 136 - (Sahih) From Aisha who said: We had a curtain containing the image of a bird, and whoever entered would face it. So the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to me: 'Move this away from me, for whenever I enter and see it, I remember the world.' Narrated by Muslim and Ahmad. An-Nawawi said: This is interpreted to be before the prohibition of acquiring items with images. See Al-Albani's commentary in the book.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 137 - (Sahih) From Anas who said: Aisha had a Qiram (a thin woolen curtain) with which she screened the side of her house. The Prophet ﷺ said to her: 'Remove it from me, for its images continue to appear to me in my prayer.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari and Ahmad. There is nothing in this Hadith indicating the images were of animate beings, nor do we know if this was before or after the prohibition.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 138 - (Sahih) What was narrated in the Hadith Qudsi from Allah the Almighty: 'And who is more unjust than one who goes to create as my creation? Let them create an atom, or let them create a grain of barley.' Narrated by the two Sheikhs (Bukhari and Muslim) and others, and it preceded under number 122. Follow the commentary as it is important.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 139 - (Sahih) From Aisha who said: She bought a cushion (Namraqah) containing images. When the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saw it, he stood at the door and did not enter. She recognized disapproval in his face, so she said: 'O Messenger of Allah, I repent to Allah and His Messenger, what sin have I committed?' He said: 'What is the matter with this cushion?' She said: 'I bought it for you to sit on and recline upon.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Indeed, the makers of these images will be punished and it will be said to them: Give life to what you have created.' Then he said: 'Indeed, the house in which there are images, the Angels do not enter.' Muslim added in a narration from Aisha: 'So I took it and made it into two pillows, and he used to recline on them in the house.' Meaning she cut the cushion and made it into two pillows. Follow the commentary.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 140 - (Sahih) 'Indeed, Allah did not command us to clothe stone and clay.' (Sahih) It is from a narration by Muslim and preceded in Hadith number 135.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 141 - (Sahih) [That Gabriel, peace be upon him, asked permission to enter upon the Prophet ﷺ, so he said: 'Enter.' He said: 'How can I enter when there is a curtain in your house with images on it? If you must keep it, then cut off its head, or cut it into pillows, or make it into floor mats.'] (Sahih). Narrated by An-Nasa'i and Ibn Hibban in his Sahih. A similar narration preceded under number 130, and this wording is not An-Nasa'i's as it differs slightly from his wording.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 142 - (Sahih) Al-Bukhari narrated that the Prophet ﷺ would not leave anything in his house containing crosses (Tasalib) without obliterating it. Taslib means images of the cross. Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Abu Dawood, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 143 - (Sahih) Ibn Abbas narrated that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, in the year of the Conquest (of Mecca), when he saw the images inside the Kaaba, did not enter until he ordered them to be erased. Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Abu Dawood, and Ahmad via Ikrimah from Ibn Abbas from the Prophet ﷺ who said: 'When he saw the images in the Holy House, he did not enter until he ordered regarding them, and they were erased. He saw Abraham and Ishmael holding divine arrows (Azlam) in their hands, so he said: May Allah fight them! By Allah, they never sought division by arrows.' And in a narration, it is added: 'So Umar dampened a cloth and erased them with it.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 144 - (Da'if - Weak) From Ali bin Abi Talib who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ was at a funeral and said: 'Who among you will go to Medina and not leave an idol without breaking it, nor a grave without leveling it, nor an image without blotting it out?' A man said: 'I will, O Messenger of Allah.' He said: The people of Medina were afraid. The man went and then returned and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, I did not leave an idol without breaking it, nor a grave without leveling it, nor an image without blotting it out.' Then the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Whoever returns to any of this has disbelieved in what was revealed to Muhammad ﷺ.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 145 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ said: 'If a dog licks the vessel of one of you, let him wash it seven times, one of them with dust.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari, but attributing this addition 'one of them with dust' to Al-Bukhari is an error, for it is absolutely not in his narration. Rather, it is in Muslim with the wording 'the first of them with dust.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 146 - (Sahih) From the Prophet ﷺ who said: 'Gabriel, peace be upon him, came to me and said: I came to you last night and nothing prevented me from entering except that there were statues at the door, and there was a curtain in the house with images on it, and there was a dog in the house. So order the head of the statue in the house to be cut off so it becomes like the shape of a tree, and order the curtain to be cut and made into two pillows that are stepped upon, and order the dog to be put out.' Narrated by Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, and Ibn Hibban.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 147 - (Sahih) The Messenger ﷺ said: 'Whoever keeps a dog, except a dog for hunting, farming, or herding livestock, one Qirat (a large measure of reward) will be deducted from his reward each day.' Narrated by the Group. Salim bin Hayyan said: I think he said: 'And a Qirat is like Mount Uhud.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 148 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Were it not that dogs are a nation among nations, I would have commanded killing them.' Narrated by Abu Dawood, At-Tirmidhi, Ad-Darimi, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad via Ibn Ubaid from Al-Hasan from Abdullah bin Mughaffal. The origin of the Hadith is in Muslim and others from another route from Ibn Mughaffal who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ ordered the killing of dogs, then said: 'What is the trouble with them and dogs?' Then he granted concession regarding the hunting dog and the sheep dog.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 149 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ narrated to his companions the story of a man who found a dog in the desert panting and eating dust out of thirst. He went to a well, took off his shoe, and filled it with water until the dog was quenched. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'So Allah thanked him and forgave him.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari and Muslim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 150 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Charity is not lawful for a rich person nor for one who is strong and sound.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 151 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ said: 'He who asks (begs) without need is like one who gathers burning coals.' Narrated by Al-Baihaqi, Ibn Khuzaimah, At-Tahawi, Ahmad, and At-Tabarani.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 152 - (Sahih) The Messenger ﷺ said: 'Whoever asks people (for money) to increase his wealth, it will be scratches on his face on the Day of Resurrection, and heated stones which he will eat from Hell; so let him who wills ask for little, and let him who wills ask for much.' Narrated by At-Tirmidhi and At-Tabarani.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 153 - (Sahih) And he said: 'Asking (begging) will not cease for one of you until he meets Allah without a piece of flesh on his face.' Agreed upon. Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, An-Nasa'i, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 154 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Begging is but scratches that a man inflicts upon his face. So whoever wishes, let him keep (his face intact), and whoever wishes, let him abandon it, unless he asks a ruler or in a matter where he finds no alternative.' 'Kadooh' means traces of scratching. Narrated by Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, At-Tahawi, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 155 - (Sahih) From Abu Bishr Qabisah bin Al-Mukhariq (RA) who said: I undertook a burden (Hamalah - debt for reconciliation), so I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ asking him for help in it. He said: 'Stay until the charity (Sadaqah) comes to us, then we will order it for you.' Then he said: 'O Qabisah, begging is not lawful except for one of three: A man who has undertaken a burden, so asking is lawful for him until he acquires it, then he must refrain; a man who has been afflicted by a calamity that destroys his wealth, so asking is lawful for him until he attains a basic livelihood; and a man who has been struck by poverty until three men of reason from his people say: "So-and-so has been struck by poverty," so asking is lawful for him until he attains a basic livelihood. Whatever is other than these forms of begging, O Qabisah, is Suht (ill-gotten gain) which its owner eats as Suht.' Narrated by Muslim, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, Ad-Darimi, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 156 - (Sahih) 'For one of you to take his rope on his back and come with a bundle of firewood and sell it, and Allah saves his face thereby, is better for him than to ask people, whether they give him or withhold from him.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad from the Hadith of Az-Zubayr bin Al-Awwam from the Prophet ﷺ. As for Muslim, he narrated it from the Hadith of Abu Huraira similarly... etc.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 157 - (Agreed upon) 'There is no Muslim who plants a tree or sows seeds, and then a bird, or a person or an animal eats from it, except that it is regarded as a charity for him.' Agreed upon.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 158 - (Sahih) 'There is no Muslim who plants a tree except that whatever is eaten from it is a charity for him, and whatever is stolen from it is a charity for him, and no one decreases it (by eating/taking) except that it is a charity for him until the Day of Resurrection.' Narrated by Muslim. Also narrated with the wording: 'There is no Muslim who sows seeds or plants a tree, and a bird, or a human, or an animal eats from it, except that it is a charity for him.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 159 - (Da'if - Weak) From a man among the Companions of the Prophet ﷺ who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying with these two ears of mine: 'Whoever plants a tree and patiently tends to its preservation and care until it bears fruit, then for everything that is taken from its fruit, he has a charity with Allah, the Mighty and Sublime.' Narrated by Ahmad via Funj, a Persian man.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 160 - (Sahih) And he ﷺ said: 'If you transact using Al-'Inah (a form of usurious transaction), follow the tails of cows, are content with agriculture, and abandon Jihad, Allah will impose upon you a humiliation which He will not remove from you until you return to your religion.' Narrated by Abu Dawood.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 161 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Allah did not send any prophet but that he herded sheep.' They said: 'And you, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'Yes, I used to herd them for the people of Mecca in exchange for Qararit (pennies).' Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Ibn Majah, and Ibn Sa'd in At-Tabaqat Al-Kubra.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 162 - (Not fully studied) Ibn Abbas narrated that David was a smith (maker of coats of mail), Adam was a farmer, Noah was a carpenter, Idris was a tailor, and Moses was a shepherd. Narrated by Al-Hakim, and Al-Albani remained silent about it.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 163 - (Sahih) 'No one has ever eaten food better than to eat from the work of his own hand. And indeed, the Prophet of Allah, David, used to eat from the work of his own hand.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 164 - (No basis) Ibn Abbas narrated that Abdullah bin Ubayy - the head of the hypocrites - came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ with a slave girl of the most beautiful women named Mu'adhah, and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, this belongs to the orphans of so-and-so, shall we not order her to commit fornication so they may benefit from her earnings?' The Prophet ﷺ said: 'No.' Al-Albani said: I did not find a basis for it with this context. Muslim narrated via Abu Sufyan from Jabir who said: Abdullah bin Ubayy bin Salul used to say to a slave girl of his: 'Go and earn something for us.' So Allah revealed: {And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, to seek [thereby] the temporary interests of worldly life. And if someone should compel them, then indeed, Allah is [to them], after their compulsion, Forgiving and Merciful.} Surah An-Nur.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 165 - (Sahih) From Sa'id bin Abi Al-Hasan who said: I was with Ibn Abbas when a man came to him and said: 'O Ibn Abbas, I am a man whose livelihood is from the work of my hands, and I make these images (statues/pictures).' Ibn Abbas said: 'I will not tell you except what I heard from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. I heard him say: Whoever makes an image, Allah will punish him until he breathes the soul into it, and he will never be able to breathe it into it.' The man swelled with extreme anger and distress.
