Ibn Abbas said: 'Woe to you! If you refuse but to make them, then stick to these trees and everything that does not have a soul.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, An-Nasa'i, and Ahmad. In a narration by Muslim and Ahmad: 'I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say: Every image maker is in the Fire; a soul will be made for him for every image he made, and it will punish him in Hell.' Al-Khatib narrated it in 'At-Tarikh' from the mentioned route briefly with the wording: 'Indeed, Allah punishes the image makers for what they depicted.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 166 - (Da'if - Weak) 'The trustworthy, truthful merchant will be with the martyrs on the Day of Resurrection.' Weak. Narrated by Ibn Majah, Ad-Daraqutni, Al-Hakim, and Al-Baihaqi.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 167 - (Da'if - Weak) 'The truthful, trustworthy merchant will be with the Prophets, the Truthful ones (Siddiqun), and the Martyrs.' Weak. Narrated by At-Tirmidhi, Ad-Darimi, Ad-Daraqutni, and Al-Hakim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 168 - (Da'if - Weak) The Prophet ﷺ went out one day to the prayer place and saw people trading. He said: 'O assembly of merchants!' They responded to the Messenger of Allah and raised their necks and eyes towards him. He said: 'Indeed, the merchants will be resurrected on the Day of Resurrection as wicked people, except for he who fears Allah, is righteous, and speaks the truth.' Weak. Narrated by At-Tirmidhi, Ibn Majah, Ibn Hibban, and Al-Hakim. The first part is supported by the Hadith of Abdur-Rahman bin Shibl Al-Ansari that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Indeed, the merchants are the wicked.' A man said: 'O Prophet of Allah, did Allah not permit selling?' He said: 'Yes, but they speak and lie, and swear oaths and commit sin.' Narrated by Ahmad and its chain is Sahih, but the rest differs from it.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 169 - (Da'if - Weak) From Wathilah bin Al-Asqa' who said: The Messenger of Allah used to come out to us - and we were merchants - and say: 'O assembly of merchants, beware of lying.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 170 - (Sahih) From Abu Dharr from the Prophet ﷺ who said: 'Three people Allah will not speak to on the Day of Resurrection, nor look at, nor purify, and they will have a painful punishment.' He said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ recited it three times. Abu Dharr said: 'They have failed and lost! Who are they, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'The one who drags his garment (Al-Musbil), the one who reminds others of his charity (Al-Mannan), and the one who sells his goods by means of false oaths.' Narrated by Muslim, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, Ad-Darimi, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 171 - (Hasan) From Abu Sa'id who said: A Bedouin passed by with a sheep. I said: 'Will you sell it for three Dirhams?' He said: 'No, by Allah.' Then he sold it (for that price). I mentioned that to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and he said: 'He sold his Hereafter for his worldly life.' Narrated by Ibn Hibban.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 172 - (Sahih) 'A dirham of Riba (usury) which a man consumes while knowing is worse than thirty-six acts of adultery.' Narrated by Ahmad, Ad-Daraqutni, and Ibn Asakir.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 173 - (Da'if - Weak) 'Woe to the commanders, woe to the chiefs, woe to the trustees (of wealth). People will surely wish on the Day of Resurrection that their forelocks were tied to the Pleiades, dangling between heaven and earth, and that they had never taken charge of any work.' Weak. Narrated by Ibn Hibban, Al-Hakim, At-Tayalisi, and Ahmad from Abu Huraira. There is another Hadith from Abu Huraira which is better in chain than this one, wording: 'I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say: A man will soon wish that he fell from the Pleiades rather than taking charge of any affair of the people.' Its chain is Hasan.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 174 - (Sahih) From Abu Dharr: I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, will you not appoint me (as a governor/official)?' He said: He struck my shoulder with his hand and said: 'O Abu Dharr, you are weak, and it is a trust, and on the Day of Resurrection it will be disgrace and regret, except for him who takes it by its right and fulfills his duty in it.' Narrated by Muslim and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 175 - (Sahih) 'Judges are three: One in Paradise and two in the Fire. As for the one in Paradise, he is a man who knew the truth and judged by it. A man who knew the truth but was unjust in judgment is in the Fire. And a man who judged for the people out of ignorance is in the Fire.' Narrated by Abu Dawood, At-Tirmidhi, and Ibn Majah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 176 - (Da'if - Weak) From Anas that the Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever seeks the judiciary and asks for intercessors for it, is entrusted to himself. And whoever is compelled to accept it, Allah sends down an angel to guide him right.' Weak. Narrated by Abu Dawood.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 177 - (Agreed upon) From Abdur-Rahman bin Samurah who said: The Messenger of Allah said to me: 'O Abdur-Rahman, do not ask for authority (imarah), for if you are given it simply because you asked for it, you will be left to handle it yourself; but if you are given it without asking for it, you will be helped in it.' Agreed upon.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 178 - (Da'if - Weak) 'A servant does not reach the rank of the God-fearing (Muttaqin) until he leaves what is harmless out of caution for what is harmful.' Weak. Narrated by At-Tirmidhi, Ibn Majah, Al-Hakim, Abdur-Rahman bin Humaid, Al-Baihaqi, Al-Quda'i, and Ibn Asakir.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 179 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Leave that which makes you doubt for that which does not make you doubt.' Sahih. Narrated by Ahmad, At-Tirmidhi, An-Nasa'i, Ibn Hibban, and Al-Hakim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 180 - (Sahih) The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him not be alone with a woman who does not have a Mahram (unmarriageable kin) with her, for indeed the third of them is Satan.' Sahih. Narrated by Ahmad and authenticated by Al-Hakim, and Adh-Dhahabi agreed.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 181 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Beware of entering upon women.' A man from the Ansar said: 'O Messenger of Allah, what about the Hamu (in-law)?' - meaning the husband's relatives. He said: 'The Hamu is death.' Agreed upon. Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, At-Tirmidhi, and Ad-Darimi. Muslim added from Al-Layth bin Sa'd: 'The Hamu is the husband's brother and similar relatives of the husband like the cousin and the like.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 182 - (Sahih) And in the Two Sahihs (Bukhari and Muslim) from Abdullah bin Abbas: 'No one of you should be alone with a woman unless she is with a Mahram.' Sahih. Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 183 - (Hasan) The Messenger ﷺ said to Ali bin Abi Talib: 'O Ali, do not follow a glance with another, for you have the first one but not the second.' Narrated by Ahmad, Abu Dawood, and At-Tirmidhi. Referenced in 'Hijab Al-Mar'ah' by Al-Albani.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 184 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ said: 'The eyes commit adultery, and their adultery is looking.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, and Ahmad from the path of Ibn Abbas who said: I have not seen anything more resembling 'Al-Lamam' (minor sins) than what Abu Huraira narrated from the Prophet ﷺ: 'Indeed, Allah has written for the son of Adam his share of adultery which he inevitably commits. The adultery of the eye is the look, the adultery of the tongue is speech, the soul wishes and desires, and the private parts either confirm that or deny it.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 185 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ said: 'A man should not look at the private parts of another man, and a woman should not look at the private parts of another woman. A man should not lie with another man under one cloth, and a woman should not lie with another woman under one cloth.' Narrated by Muslim, Abu Dawood, At-Tirmidhi, and Ibn Majah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 186 - (Sahih) The Messenger ﷺ permitted Aisha to look at the Abyssinians while they were playing with their spears in the Prophet's Mosque, and she kept looking at them until she became bored and turned away. Agreed upon. It is referenced in 'Adab Az-Zafaf' with a compilation of the wording from other narrations.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 187 - (Hasan) From Aisha that Asma bint Abi Bakr - her sister - entered upon the Prophet ﷺ in thin clothes that revealed her body. The Prophet turned away from her and said: 'O Asma, when a woman reaches menstruation (puberty), it is not correct that anything be seen of her except this and this,' pointing to his face and hands. Hasan. Referenced in 'Hijab Al-Mar'ah Al-Muslimah'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 188 - (Sahih) From Jarir bin Abdullah who said: I asked the Messenger of Allah ﷺ about the accidental glance (Fuja'ah), and he said: 'Avert your gaze,' meaning do not look a second time. Sahih. Narrated by Ahmad, Muslim, Abu Dawood, and At-Tirmidhi. Referenced in 'Hijab Al-Mar'ah Al-Muslimah'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 189 - (Sahih) 'The uncle of a man is the twin half (Sinw) of his father.' Sahih. It is a piece of a Hadith from Abu Huraira narrated by Muslim and others. Referenced in 'Al-Irwa'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 190 - (Hasan) From Jabir (RA) from the Prophet ﷺ who said: 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should not enter the bathhouse (Hammam) without a waist wrapper. And whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should not allow his wife to enter the bathhouse.' Hasan. Narrated by An-Nasa'i, Al-Hakim, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 191 - (Da'if - Weak) From Aisha (RA) that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ forbade entering bathhouses, then he permitted men to enter them in waist wrappers. Weak. Narrated by Abu Dawood, At-Tirmidhi, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 192 - (Da'if - Weak) From Abdullah bin Umar that the Prophet ﷺ said regarding bathhouses: 'Men should not enter them except with a waist wrapper, and prevent women from them unless sick or in postpartum bleeding.' Weak. Narrated by Abu Dawood and Ibn Majah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 193 - (Sahih) From Ibn Abbas that the Prophet ﷺ said: 'Beware of a house called the Hammam (bathhouse).' They said: 'O Messenger of Allah, it removes dirt and benefits the sick.' He said: 'Then whoever enters it should cover up.' Sahih. Narrated by Al-Hakim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 194 - (Sahih) From Aisha (RA): I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say: 'There is no woman who takes off her clothes in other than her husband's house except that she has torn the veil between her and her Lord.' Sahih. Narrated by At-Tirmidhi (wording is his), Abu Dawood, Ibn Majah, and Al-Hakim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 195 - (Sahih) From Umm Salamah that he ﷺ said: 'Any woman who removes her clothes in other than her own house, Allah tears His cover from her.' Sahih due to the previous one. Narrated by Ahmad and Al-Hakim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 196 - (Hasan) Ma'qil bin Yasar narrated from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ that he said: 'For one of you to be stabbed in the head with an iron needle is better for him than to touch a woman who is not lawful for him.' Hasan. Narrated by At-Tabarani and Al-Baihaqi. Referenced in 'Silsilat As-Sahihah' no. 226.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 197 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ informed that among the people of Hell are 'women who are clothed yet naked, inclining and inviting (to sin), they will not enter Paradise nor smell its fragrance.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 198 - (Sahih) 'Whoever imitates a people is one of them.' Sahih. Referenced in 'Hijab Al-Mar'ah Al-Muslimah'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 199 - (Sahih) 'If a woman perfumes herself and passes by a gathering, she is such and such' meaning: an adulteress. Narrated by Abu Dawood and At-Tirmidhi who said it is Hasan Sahih. Also narrated by An-Nasa'i, Ibn Khuzaimah, and Ibn Hibban with the wording: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Any woman who perfumes herself and passes by people so they may smell her fragrance, she is an adulteress.' Al-Hakim also narrated it and said: Authentic chain. Referenced in 'Hijab Al-Mar'ah Al-Muslimah'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 200 - (Sahih) And he ﷺ said to his wife Sawdah: 'Allah has permitted you to go out for your needs.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari and Muslim. Referenced in 'Hijab Al-Mar'ah Al-Muslimah'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 201 - (Sahih) 'If the wife of one of you asks permission to go to the mosque, do not prevent her.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari and Muslim. Al-Bukhari has it with another wording: 'If your women ask permission at night to go to the mosque, allow them.' Muslim and Ahmad's wording: 'If the wife of one of you asks permission to go to the mosque, do not prevent her.' They added in a narration: Bilal bin Abdullah said: 'By Allah, we will prevent them!' Abdullah turned to him and insulted him with a bad insult the likes of which I had never heard before, and said: 'I tell you from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and you say: By Allah we will prevent them!'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 202 - (Sahih) 'Do not prevent the female servants of Allah from the mosques of Allah.' Narrated by Muslim and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 203 - (Da'if - Weak) From Nabhan, the client of Umm Salamah, that the Prophet ﷺ said to her and Maimunah when Ibn Umm Maktum entered upon them: 'Screen yourselves.' They said: 'He is blind.' He said: 'Are you two blind? Do you not see him?' Weak. Referenced in 'Irwa Al-Ghalil'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 204 - (Sahih) That the Prophet ﷺ ordered Fatima bint Qais to observe her Iddah (waiting period) in the house of Umm Sharik, then he corrected himself saying: 'That is a woman whom my companions visit frequently. Observe your Iddah at Ibn Umm Maktum's house, for he is a blind man; you can take off your clothes and he will not see you.' Sahih. Narrated by Malik, and from him Muslim, as well as Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, and Ahmad, all from Malik.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 205 - (Sahih) The two Sheikhs and others narrated from Sahl bin Sa'd Al-Ansari who said: When Abu Usaid As-Sa'idi got married, he invited the Prophet ﷺ and his companions. No one prepared food for them nor served it to them except his wife, Umm Usaid. She had soaked dates in a stone vessel at night. When the Prophet ﷺ finished eating, she mashed it for him - meaning rubbed it with her hand - and gave it to him to drink - honoring him with that. Sahih. Referenced in 'Adab Az-Zafaf'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 206 - (Sahih) 'O young men, whoever among you can afford to marry, let him marry, for it lowers the gaze and protects the private parts. And whoever cannot afford it, let him fast, for it is a shield for him.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari and the rest of the six from the Hadith of Abdullah bin Mas'ud.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 207 - (Da'if - Weak) 'Those before you were destroyed only because of their strictness; they were strict on themselves so Allah was strict on them. Those are their remnants in monasteries and cells. So worship Allah and associate nothing with Him, perform Hajj and Umrah, and be upright so you may be treated uprightly.' Weak with this wording. But Abu Dawood and Al-Wahidi in his Tafsir narrated from Ibn Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Al-Amya that Sahl bin Abi Umamah entered with his father upon Anas bin Malik in Medina, and he said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ used to say: 'Do not be strict on yourselves lest strictness be imposed on you, for a people were strict on themselves...' The Hadith, without saying 'So worship Allah...'. Al-Albani said: Perhaps like this it is Hasan.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 208 - (Agreed upon) A group of Companions went to the houses of the Prophet ﷺ asking his wives about his worship. When they were informed about it, they considered it little. Then they said: 'Where are we compared to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ when his past and future sins have been forgiven?' One of them said: 'As for me, I will fast forever and not break it.' The second said: 'And I will pray all night and not sleep.' The third said: 'And I will keep away from women.' When this reached the Prophet ﷺ - he clarified their error and the crookedness of their path - and said to them: 'Indeed, I am the most knowledgeable of you regarding Allah and the most fearful of Him, yet I stand (in prayer) and sleep, I fast and break my fast, and I marry women. So whoever turns away from my Sunnah is not of me.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari and Muslim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 209 - (Sahih) 'O young men, whoever among you can afford to marry, let him marry, for it lowers the gaze and protects the private parts.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 210 - (Hasan) 'Three have a right upon Allah to help them: The one getting married who desires chastity, the Mukatab (slave) who wants to pay (for his freedom), and the fighter in the cause of Allah.' Hasan. Narrated by Ahmad, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, Ibn Majah, Al-Hakim, and Abu Ya'la.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 211 - (Sahih) From Abu Huraira who said: I was with the Prophet ﷺ when a man came to him and informed him that he had married a woman from the Ansar. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Did you look at her?' He said: 'No.' He said: 'Go and look at her, for there is something in the eyes of the Ansar.' Narrated by Muslim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 212 - (Sahih) Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah narrated that he proposed to a woman, and the Prophet ﷺ said: 'Look at her, for it is more likely to create affection between you.' So he went to her parents and informed them of the Messenger of Allah's ﷺ saying. It was as if they disliked it. The woman heard this while she was in her private room and said: 'If the Messenger of Allah ﷺ ordered you to look, then look.' Al-Mughirah said: So I looked at her and married her. Narrated by Ahmad, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmidhi, Ibn Hibban, and Ad-Darimi.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 213 - (Hasan) 'If one of you proposes to a woman and is able to look at what induces him to marry her, let him do so.' Hasan. Narrated by Ahmad and Abu Dawood.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 214 - (Sahih) 'The believer is the brother of the believer, so it is not lawful for a believer to outbid his brother in a sale nor propose over his brother's proposal.' Narrated by Muslim, and likewise Al-Baihaqi and Ahmad without the first sentence.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 215 - (Sahih) 'A man should not propose over the proposal of another man until the first suitor gives up or permits him.' Narrated by Al-Bukhari, and likewise An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 216 - (Sahih) 'The previously married woman has more right to herself than her guardian, and the virgin's permission is sought regarding herself, and her permission is her silence.' Sahih. It is from the Hadith of Abdullah bin Abbas (RA) and is unique to Muslim; Al-Bukhari did not narrate it.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 217 - (Da'if - Weak) A young woman came to the Prophet ﷺ and informed him that her father married her to his nephew while she disliked him. The Prophet ﷺ gave her the choice. She said: 'I have allowed what my father did, but I wanted to teach women that fathers have no right in the matter (to force marriage).' Weak. Narrated by Ibn Majah and others.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 218 - (Da'if - Weak) 'Three things are not to be delayed: The prayer when it comes due, the funeral when it is present, and the single woman (widow/divorcee) when a suitable match is found for her.' Weak. Referenced in 'Ahkam Al-Jana'iz wa Bida'uha'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 219 - (Hasan) 'If someone comes to you whose religion and character you are pleased with, then marry him off. If you do not do so, there will be tribulation on earth and great corruption.' Hasan. Referenced in 'Irwa Al-Ghalil'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 220 - (Sahih) 'Breastfeeding prohibits what lineage prohibits.' Agreed upon. Referenced in 'Al-Irwa'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 221 - (Sahih) 'One should not combine in marriage a woman and her paternal aunt, nor a woman and her maternal aunt.' A Mutawatir Hadith narrated by seven Companions, including Abu Huraira, and it has seven routes from him alone. Referenced in 'Al-Irwa'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 222 - (Sahih) 'Choose the one with religion, may your hands be dusty (may you prosper).' Narrated by Al-Bukhari, and likewise Muslim, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, Ad-Darimi, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad. Referenced in 'As-Sahihah' 303.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 223 - (Sahih) It was narrated that Marthad bin Abi Marthad asked permission from the Prophet ﷺ to marry a prostitute with whom he had a relationship in Pre-Islamic days - named 'Anaq. The Prophet ﷺ turned away from him until the verse was revealed: {The fornicator does not marry except a [female] fornicator or polytheist, and none marries her except a fornicator or a polytheist, and that has been made unlawful to the believers.} The Prophet ﷺ recited the verse to him and said: 'Do not marry her.' The story is in Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, and At-Tirmidhi. Sahih. Referenced in 'Al-Irwa'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 224 - (Agreed upon) Ibn Mas'ud said: We used to go on campaigns with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and we had no women with us. So we said: 'Shall we not castrate ourselves?' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ forbade us from that and permitted us to marry a woman for a garment for a fixed period. Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, and Ahmad. Then Mut'ah (temporary marriage) was forbidden after that, as mentioned in the following Hadith number 225.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 225 - (Sahih) Muslim narrated in his Sahih from Sabrah Al-Juhani that he was on a campaign with the Prophet ﷺ during the Conquest of Mecca, and he permitted them Mut'ah (temporary marriage) with women. He said: 'He did not leave until the Messenger of Allah ﷺ prohibited it.' And in a wording from his narration: 'And indeed Allah has prohibited that until the Day of Resurrection.' Sahih. Referenced in 'Al-Irwa'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 226 - (Sahih) Ghilan Ath-Thaqafi accepted Islam while he had ten wives... Sahih. Narrated by Ash-Shafi'i, Ahmad, Ibn Majah, Ibn Abi Shaybah, Ad-Daraqutni, and Al-Baihaqi. Referenced in 'Al-Irwa'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 227 - (Hasan) Likewise, the one who accepted Islam with eight (wives). Hasan. Narrated by Abu Dawood. Referenced in 'Al-Irwa'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 228 - (Da'if - Weak) And concerning five (wives), the Prophet ﷺ forbade him to keep more than four of them.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 229 - (Sahih) 'Whoever has two wives and inclines towards one of them over the other, will come on the Day of Resurrection dragging one of his sides drooping or leaning.' Sahih. Narrated by Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, Ibn Majah, Ad-Darimi, Ibn Hibban, Al-Hakim, At-Tayalisi, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 230 - (Da'if - Weak) The Messenger of Allah ﷺ used to divide (his time) equally and say: 'O Allah, this is my division in what I control, so do not blame me for what You control and I do not control.' Weak. Narrated by the authors of the Sunan and others.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 231 - (Agreed upon) When he intended to travel, he would cast lots between them (his wives), and whichever one's arrow came out, he would travel with her. Agreed upon. It has several narrations, see the book.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 232 - (Not fully studied) 'I only commanded you to avoid sexual intercourse with them when they menstruate, and I did not command you to put them out of the houses like the practice of the Persians (non-Arabs).' When the Jews heard this, they said: 'This man does not want to leave anything of our affairs except that he opposes us in it.' Al-Albani said: I did not find it with this context in any of the books of Sunnah that I have. See the book, for he mentioned similar Hadiths, including the Hadith of Anas bin Malik (RA) that the Jews, when a woman among them menstruated, would not eat with her nor associate with her in the houses. So the companions of the Prophet ﷺ asked the Prophet ﷺ, and Allah revealed: {And they ask you about menstruation...} So the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Do everything except intercourse.' When this reached the Jews, they said... etc. Sahih. Narrated by Muslim and others.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 233 - (Sahih) 'Do not come unto women in their anuses.' Sahih from the Hadith of Khuzaimah bin Thabit. Referenced in 'Al-Irwa' and 'Adab Az-Zafaf'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 234 - (Hasan) 'It is the minor sodomy' meaning a man coming unto his wife in her anus. Hasan. Narrated by Ahmad from Amr bin Shu'aib from his father from his grandfather that the Prophet ﷺ said: (he mentioned it).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 235 - (Sahih) A woman from the Ansar asked him about having intercourse with a woman in her front passage from the direction of her back. He recited to her the verse: {Your wives are a place of sowing of seed for you, so come to your place of cultivation however you wish} (meaning) in one opening (the vagina). Sahih. Referenced in 'Adab Az-Zafaf'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 236 - (Hasan) Umar bin Al-Khattab came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, I am destroyed.' He said: 'What destroyed you?' He said: 'I turned my mount around last night (had vaginal intercourse from behind).' He did not reply to him with anything. Then it was revealed to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ: {Your wives are a place of sowing of seed for you, so come to your place of cultivation however you wish}. He said: 'Approach from the front or the back, but avoid the anus and menstruation.' Narrated by An-Nasa'i in 'Al-Ishrah', At-Tabarani, and Al-Wahidi with a Hasan chain. The text of the Hadith is from 'Adab Az-Zafaf'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 237 - (Da'if - Weak) 'Indeed, among the people with the worst status before Allah on the Day of Resurrection is the man who is intimate with his wife and she with him, then he spreads her secret.' Weak. Referenced in 'Adab Az-Zafaf'.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 238 - (Da'if - Weak) From Abu Huraira who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ led us in prayer, and when he finished, he turned to us and said: 'Stay in your places. Is there any man among you who, when he goes to his wife, closes his door and lowers his curtain, then goes out and speaks saying: "I did such-and-such with my wife, and I did such-and-such with my wife"?' They remained silent. Then he turned to the women and said: 'Is there any of you who speaks?' A young girl sat up on one of her knees and craned her neck so the Messenger of Allah ﷺ could see her and hear her speech, and she said: 'Yes, by Allah... they speak and the women speak.' He ﷺ said: 'Do you know what the likeness of one who does that is? The likeness of one who does that is the likeness of a male devil and a female devil; one met the other in the street and fulfilled his need with her while the people were looking at him.' Weak. Narrated by Ahmad, Abu Dawood, and Al-Bazzar.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 239 - (Sahih) Narrated in the two Sahihs from Jabir: "We used to practice Azl (coitus interruptus) during the time of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ while the Quran was being revealed." And in Sahih Muslim, he said: "We used to practice Azl during the time of the Messenger of Allah, and news of that reached the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and he did not forbid us." Sahih, extracted in Adab az-Zafaf.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 240 - (Sahih) A man came to the Prophet ﷺ and said: "O Messenger of Allah, I have a slave girl and I practice Azl with her. I dislike that she becomes pregnant, but I desire what men desire. The Jews say that Azl is the minor infanticide." He (peace be upon him) said: "The Jews have lied. If Allah wanted to create him, you would not be able to prevent it." Recorded by the authors of the Sunan. It is Sahih, extracted in Adab az-Zafaf.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 241 - (Sahih) From Usama bin Zaid, that a man came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and said: "O Messenger of Allah, I practice Azl with my wife." The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to him: "Why do you do that?" The man said: "I fear for her child" (or he said: "for her children"). The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "If it were harmful, it would have harmed the Persians and the Romans." Recorded by Muslim and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 242 - (Weak) From his ﷺ diligence for his nation, he said: "Do not kill your children secretly, for the Ghayl (intercourse during breastfeeding) overtakes the horseman and throws him from his horse." Weak. Recorded by Abu Dawood and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 243 - (Sahih) "I intended to forbid Ghila (intercourse during breastfeeding), but then I saw the Persians and the Romans doing it, and it does not harm their children at all." Sahih. Recorded by Muslim, Malik, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, Ad-Darimi, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 244 - (Sahih) A man asked the Prophet ﷺ saying: "O Messenger of Allah, what is the right of the wife of one of us upon him?" He said: "That you feed her when you eat, and clothe her when you clothe yourself, and do not strike the face, do not revile her, and do not boycott her except within the house." Sahih. Recorded by Abu Dawood and Ibn Hibban.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 245 - (Weak) "It is sufficient sin for a man that he neglects those he feeds." Recorded by Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, and Al-Hakim. Weak with this wording. Muslim recorded it with the wording: "...that he withholds from those whose provision he possesses."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 246 - (Weak) "It is not lawful for a woman who believes in Allah to allow anyone into her husband's house while he dislikes it, nor to go out while he dislikes it, nor to obey anyone regarding him, nor to withdraw from his bed, nor to strike him (if she is physically stronger than him). If he is the one who is unjust, then let her come to him until she pleases him. If he accepts from her, then that is good, and Allah accepts her excuse and proves her argument. But if he is not pleased, then she has conveyed her excuse to Allah." Weak. Recorded by Al-Hakim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 247 - (Sahih) "A believing man should not hate (yafruk) a believing woman. If he dislikes a trait in her, he is pleased with another." Sahih. Recorded by Muslim and Ahmad from Abu Hurayrah, except that they said: "he dislikes" (kariha) instead of "he is displeased" (sakhita).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 248 - (Weak) "Three people's prayers are not raised above their heads by a handspan: A man who leads a people while they dislike him, a woman who spends the night while her husband is angry with her, and two brothers who are cutting ties (quarreling)." Weak. Recorded by Ibn Majah, Ibn Hibban, and Al-Diya' in Al-Mukhtarah. However, the Hadith has a witness from the Hadith of Abu Umamah, Marfu' (attributed to the Prophet), except that he said: "A fugitive slave" instead of "two brothers cutting ties." Recorded by At-Tirmidhi with a Hasan chain.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 249 - (Weak) He (peace be upon him) said to a servant of his who angered him in some work: "If it were not for retaliation (Qisas) on the Day of Resurrection, I would have hurt you with this Siwak (tooth-stick)." Weak. Recorded by Ibn Sa'd in Al-Tabaqat Al-Kubra from Dawood bin Abdullah from Ibn Jud'an from his grandmother from Umm Salamah that the Prophet ﷺ sent a maidservant of his and she delayed, so he said... and mentioned it. This chain is weak.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 250 - (Sahih) "How does one of you beat his wife as a slave is beaten?" Sahih. Recorded by Ahmad and Al-Bukhari, as well as Muslim, At-Tirmidhi, Ad-Darimi, and Ibn Majah from the Hadith of Abdullah bin Zam'ah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "How does one of you flog his wife as a slave is flogged, and perhaps he sleeps with her at the end of his day?" This is Ahmad's wording. In a narration by him: "How does one strike..." except he said: "then he sleeps with her at the end of the night." All of them said "sleeps with her" except Al-Bukhari in one of his narrations, the wording of which is: "One of you should not flog his wife as a slave is flogged then have intercourse with her at the end of the day."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 251 - (Weak) "You will not find those to be the best of you." He said it regarding those who beat their wives. It is weak, but it has a witness recorded by Ibn Hibban that the men asked permission from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ to beat the women, so he permitted them, and they beat them. He spent the night and heard a loud noise, so he said: "What is this?" They said: "You permitted men to beat women, so they beat them." So he forbade them and said: "The best of you are the best to his family, and I am the best of you to my family." It has another witness in Al-Hakim from the path of Umm Kulthum bint Abi Bakr (may Allah be pleased with her) who said: Men were forbidden from beating women, then they complained about them to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, so he left them to beat them. Then he said: "Seventy women have gone round the family of Muhammad ﷺ tonight, all of them having been beaten." Yahya said: I think Al-Qasim said: Then it was said to them after that: "And the best of you do not beat." Perhaps the Hadith is strengthened by these two witnesses and ascends to the level of Hasan.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 252 - (Sahih) "The Messenger of Allah ﷺ never struck a wife of his, nor a servant, nor did he strike anything with his hand ever, except in the cause of Allah, or if the sacred prohibitions of Allah were violated, then he would take vengeance for the sake of Allah." Sahih. Recorded by An-Nasa'i in Al-Kubra with this wording, and by Muslim and Ahmad with this completeness, and by Ad-Darimi and Ibn Majah in summary. Al-Bukhari has the last sentence of it with the wording: "And the Messenger of Allah ﷺ never took vengeance for himself unless the prohibition of Allah was violated, then he would take vengeance for Allah because of it." This is also a narration of Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 253 - (Weak) "The most hated of lawful things to Allah is divorce." "Allah has not made anything lawful more hated to Him than divorce." Weak. Recorded by Abu Dawood with the first wording from Muharib bin Dithar from Ibn Umar as Marfu', and with the other wording from Muharib as Mursal, which is the correct one as stated in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 254 - (Sahih) "There should be no harming and no reciprocating harm." Sahih based on the sum of its chains. Recorded by Ibn Majah and Al-Daraqutni.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 255 - (Weak) "I do not like men who are tasters (habitual divorcers) nor women who are tasters." Weak. At-Tabarani and Al-Daraqutni.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 256 - (Weak) "Indeed Allah does not love men who are tasters nor women who are tasters." Weak. Recorded by Ibn Abi Shaybah in Al-Musannaf from Layth from Shahr bin Hawshab who said: A man married a woman during the time of the Prophet ﷺ and divorced her. The Prophet ﷺ said to him: "Did you divorce her?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Was there a reason (Ba's)?" He said: "No, O Messenger of Allah." Then he married another and divorced her. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to him: "Did you divorce her?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Was there a reason?" He said: "No, O Messenger of Allah." Then he married another and divorced her. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to him: "Did you divorce her?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Was there a reason?" He said: "No, O Messenger of Allah." So the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said regarding the third one... and mentioned it. This is a weak chain.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 257 - (Sahih) In the Sahih, Abdullah bin Umar divorced his wife while she was menstruating during the time of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. Umar bin Al-Khattab asked the Messenger of Allah ﷺ about that. He said to him: "Order him to take her back, then if he wishes, he may divorce her while she is pure before touching her (having intercourse). That is the divorce for the prescribed period ('Iddah) as Allah Almighty commanded in His saying: {O Prophet, when you divorce women, divorce them for their prescribed periods}" meaning facing their prescribed periods, and that is in the state of purity. In a narration: "Order him to take her back, then let him divorce her while she is pure or pregnant." Sahih. It has many wordings and paths exceeding ten, extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 258 - (Sahih) Ibn Umar was asked: "What do you say about a man who divorces his wife while she is menstruating?" So he narrated to the questioner his story when he divorced his wife while she was menstruating, and that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ returned her to him and did not consider it anything. Sahih. However, his saying "did not consider it anything" is not a text implying he did not consider it a divorce; rather, the meaning is he did not consider it correct [procedure].

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 259 - (Sahih) "Whoever swears by other than Allah has committed Shirk." Sahih. Recorded by Abu Dawood, At-Tirmidhi, and Al-Hakim. It is extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 260 - (Sahih) "Whoever swears, let him swear by Allah or remain silent." Recorded by Muslim and Al-Bukhari. It is in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 261 - (Sahih) It is authentic that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ was informed about a man who divorced his wife with three pronouncements all at once. He stood up in anger and said: "Is the Book of Allah being played with while I am among you?" until a man stood up and said: "O Messenger of Allah, shall I kill him?" Sahih. Recorded by An-Nasa'i.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 262 - (Sahih) The wife of Thabit bin Qais came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and said: "O Messenger of Allah, regarding Thabit bin Qais, I do not fault his character or religion, but I cannot stand him out of hatred." He asked her what she had taken from him. She said: "A garden." He said to her: "Will you return his garden to him?" She said: "Yes." The Prophet ﷺ said to Thabit: "Accept the garden and divorce her once." Sahih. Recorded by Al-Bukhari and An-Nasa'i. It is extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 263 - (Sahih) "Any woman who asks her husband for divorce without reason (ba's), the fragrance of Paradise is forbidden for her." Sahih. Narrated by Abu Dawood. It is extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 264 - (Sahih) "The child belongs to the bed (the husband)." Agreed upon. It is extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 265 - (Sahih) "I and the guardian of the orphan are in Paradise like this" —and he pointed with his index and middle fingers and separated them slightly. Sahih. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Abu Dawood, At-Tirmidhi, and Ahmad from the Hadith of Sahl bin Sa'd Al-Sa'idi (Marfu'). Al-Bukhari added "slightly", which is for Ahmad with the wording "a little". It has a witness from the Hadith of Abu Hurayrah (Marfu') similar to it, recorded by Muslim and Ahmad from the path of Malik from Thawr bin Zaid Al-Dili who said: I heard Abu Al-Ghayth narrating from Abu Hurayrah regarding it, and his wording is: "The guardian of the orphan—whether his own or another's—I and he are like these two in Paradise if he fears Allah." Malik pointed with his index and middle fingers. Muslim does not have "if he fears Allah." It is in Al-Muwatta from the path of Safwan bin Sulaym (Marfu' Mursal).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 266 - (Sahih) "Whoever claims relationship to other than his father or attributes himself to other than his masters (Mawali), upon him is the curse of Allah, the angels, and all the people. Allah will not accept from him on the Day of Resurrection any Sarf (repentance) or Adl (ransom)." Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated this from the pulpit from a scroll he had from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. Agreed upon. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, and Ahmad. Abu Dawood recorded the first part of it from the Hadith of Anas bin Malik with the wording: "Upon him is the consecutive curse of Allah until the Day of Resurrection." Its chain is Sahih.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 267 - (Sahih) From Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas from him (Prophet ﷺ) that he said: "Whoever claims relationship to other than his father while he knows he is not his father, Paradise is forbidden for him." Sahih. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Ad-Darimi, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad from the path of Abu Uthman from Sa'd regarding it. (He said): I mentioned it to Abu Bakrah, and he said: "My ears heard it and my heart retained it from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 268 - (Sahih) He (peace be upon him) was asked: "Which sin is greatest?" He said: "That you set up a rival to Allah while He created you." It was said: "Then which?" He said: "That you kill your child for fear that he will eat with you." Sahih. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, and Ahmad from the Hadith of Abdullah bin Mas'ud (Marfu').

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 269 - (Sahih) "All of you are guardians (shepherds) and all of you are responsible for your flock." Sahih. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawood, At-Tirmidhi, and Ahmad from paths from Abdullah bin Umar regarding it. It is a piece of a Hadith.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 270 - (Weak) The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "It is sufficient sin for a man that he neglects those he feeds."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 271 - (Sahih) "Indeed Allah will ask every guardian about what He put under his guardianship, whether he preserved it or wasted it, until the man is asked about the people of his household." Sahih. Recorded by Ibn Hibban.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 272 - (Sahih) "Be just between your children, be just between your children, be just between your children." Sahih. Recorded by Ahmad, Abu Dawood, and An-Nasa'i. Muslim and others recorded it via another path from An-Nu'man regarding it without repetition. It is extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 273 - (Sahih) That the wife of Bashir bin Sa'd Al-Ansari asked him to favor her son Nu'man bin Bashir with a financial gift—such as a garden or a slave—and she wanted to authenticate this gift, so she asked him to make the Messenger of Allah ﷺ a witness to it. He went to him and said: "O Messenger of Allah, the daughter of so-and-so—his wife—asked me to gift her son my boy—my slave." He ﷺ said: "Does he have brothers?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Did you give all of them the like of what you gave him?" He said: "No." He said: "Then this is not correct, and I do not witness except to the truth." Sahih. Recorded by Muslim, Ahmad, and Abu Dawood. It is extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 274 - (Weak) "Do not make me a witness to injustice. Indeed, your children have a right upon you that you be just between them, just as you have a right upon them that they be dutiful to you." Weak with this wording. Recorded by Abu Dawood. As for his saying "Do not make me a witness to injustice," it is Sahih and confirmed in the Two Sahihs and others. In a narration by Abu Dawood: "Does it not please you that they be equal to you in dutifulness and kindness?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Then make someone other than me witness to this." Its chain is Sahih according to the condition of Muslim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 275 - (Sahih) "Fear Allah and be just between your children." Recorded by the Two Sheikhs and extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 276 - (Sahih) A man came asking the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: "Who among people is most deserving of my good companionship?" He said: "Your mother." He asked: "Then who?" He said: "Your mother." He asked: "Then who?" He said: "Your mother." He asked: "Then who?" He said: "Your father." Agreed upon. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 277 - (Sahih) "Shall I not inform you of the greatest of major sins?" (three times). They said: "Yes, O Messenger of Allah." He said: "Associating partners with Allah and disobedience to parents." He was reclining, so he sat up and said: "Beware of false speech and false testimony." Sahih. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, At-Tirmidhi, and Ahmad from the Hadith of Abu Bakrah (may Allah be pleased with him). It has a witness in the Two Sahihs from the Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) with the wording "The greatest of major sins..." mentioning them and adding "killing a soul", and it does not mention sitting up.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 278 - (Sahih) "Three will not enter Paradise: The one who is undutiful to his parents, the Dayyuth (cuckold), and the Rijlah (masculine woman)." Sahih. Recorded by An-Nasa'i and Al-Bazzar. It is extracted in Hijab Al-Mar'ah Al-Muslimah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 279 - (Weak) "Allah delays whatever He wills of all sins until the Day of Resurrection, except for disobedience to parents, for indeed Allah hastens it for its doer in life before death." Weak. Recorded by Al-Hakim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 280 - (Sahih) "Indeed, one of the greatest of major sins is for a man to curse his parents." (The people found it strange that a sane believing man would curse his parents who are the cause of his life) so they said: "And how does a man curse his parents?" He said: "He reviles a man's father, so he reviles his father; and he reviles his mother, so he reviles his mother." Agreed upon. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawood, At-Tirmidhi, and Ahmad. The wording is Al-Bukhari's, excluding what is in parentheses, which is explanatory.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 281 - (Sahih) A man came to the Prophet ﷺ asking his permission for Jihad. He said: "Are your parents alive?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Then strive in (serving) them." Agreed upon from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas. In a narration from him, he said: A man came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and said: "I pledge allegiance to you for migration and Jihad, seeking reward from Allah." He said: "Is either of your parents alive?" He said: "Yes, rather both are." He said: "Do you seek reward from Allah?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Then return to your parents and keep them good company." Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 282 - (Weak) From Abu Sa'id that a man from the people of Yemen migrated to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. He asked: "Do you have anyone in Yemen?" He said: "My parents." He asked: "Did they permit you?" He said: "No." He said: "Then return to them and ask their permission. If they permit you, then strive (in Jihad), otherwise be dutiful to them." Weak with this context. Recorded by Abu Dawood.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 283 - (Not Studied) Some delegations came to the Prophet ﷺ and thought he was one of those who claimed knowledge of the Unseen, so they hid something in their hands for him and said to him: "Tell us what this is." He said to them frankly: "I am not a soothsayer (Kahin). Indeed, the soothsayer, soothsaying, and the soothsayers are in the Fire." Al-Albani said: I did not find its chain.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 284 - (Sahih) "Whoever goes to a fortune-teller (Arraf) and asks him about something and believes what he says, prayer will not be accepted from him for forty days." Sahih. Recorded by Muslim, Ahmad, and Al-Bukhari in Al-Tarikh Al-Saghir.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 285 - (Sahih) "Whoever goes to a soothsayer (Kahin) and believes what he says has disbelieved in what was revealed to Muhammad ﷺ." Recorded by Al-Bazzar. The Hadith is Sahih, extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 286 - (Sahih) "He will not attain the high ranks who practices soothsaying, or seeks divination by arrows, or returns from his travel due to an omen."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 287 - (Sahih) "Avoid the seven destructive sins (Mubiqat)." They said: "O Messenger of Allah, what are they?" He said: "Associating partners with Allah, magic, killing the soul which Allah has forbidden except by right, consuming usury (Riba), consuming the wealth of the orphan, fleeing on the day of battle, and slandering chaste, unaware, believing women." Agreed upon. Extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 288 - (Weak) "Whoever blows on a knot has performed magic, and whoever performs magic has committed Shirk." Weak. Recorded by An-Nasa'i and Ibn Adi. In a narration: "Whoever ties a knot then blows on it has performed magic, and whoever performs magic has committed Shirk, and whoever hangs something (an amulet) is entrusted to it."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 289 - (Hasan) "He is not of us who seeks omens or has omens sought for him, or predicts the future or has the future predicted for him, or performs magic or has magic performed for him." See Al-Albani's comment, for he did not confirm the authenticity of the Hadith [as Sahih], but said: However, the Hadith ascends to the level of Hasan due to the Hadith of Ibn Abbas (Marfu') like it. Al-Mundhiri said: At-Tabarani narrated it with a Hasan chain. He said this, but it is questionable, for it contains Zam'ah bin Salih who is weak. Then he said regarding Hadith No. 300, which is similar to it, that it is Hasan due to supporting evidence (Li-ghayrihi).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 290 - (Not Studied) "Whoever goes to a fortune-teller (Arraf), a magician, or a soothsayer (Kahin), asks him, and believes what he says, has disbelieved in what was revealed to Muhammad ﷺ." See Al-Albani's comment, as he did not confirm the authenticity of the Hadith but said: If the chain to Al-Thawri is authentic, then it is Sahih.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 291 - (Hasan) "An addict of wine, a believer in magic, and one who severs ties of kinship will not enter Paradise." Hasan. Recorded by Ibn Hibban.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 292 - (Sahih) "Treat yourselves, for He who created the disease created the cure." Al-Bukhari. Sahih. But Al-Bukhari did not record it with this wording, nor did others. They recorded many hadiths with its meaning. The closest to it is the Hadith of Anas that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Indeed Allah Almighty, where He created disease, He created a cure, so treat yourselves." Its chain is Jayyid (good). Close to it is the Hadith of Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (Marfu'): "Allah did not send down a disease—or did not create a disease—except that He sent down—or created—a cure for it, known to those who know it and unknown to those who are ignorant of it, except for Al-Sam." They said: "O Messenger of Allah, what is Al-Sam?" He said: "Death." Its chain is Hasan. As for Al-Bukhari, he narrated it with the wording: "Allah has not sent down a disease except that He sent down a cure for it." Muslim and Al-Hakim recorded it with the wording: "For every disease there is a remedy; so if the remedy of the disease hits, it is cured by the permission of Allah Almighty." And from Usama bin Sharik (Marfu') with the wording: "Treat yourselves, for Allah Almighty did not place a disease except that He placed a cure for it, except for one disease: Old age." He added in a narration: "Known to those who know it and unknown to those who are ignorant of it." Recorded by Al-Bukhari in Al-Adab Al-Mufrad, Abu Dawood, At-Tirmidhi, Ibn Majah, Ibn Hibban, Al-Hakim, Al-Tayalisi, Al-Humaydi, and Ahmad. The addition is his in a narration, and he added at the beginning—as did Ibn Majah and Ahmad—"O Servants of Allah... Allah has removed hardship except for a man who assaults the honor of his brother wrongfully; that is what causes hardship and destruction." From a man of the Ansar who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ visited a man with a wound and the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Call the physician of Banu so-and-so for him." They called him and he came. They said: "O Messenger of Allah, does medicine avail anything?" He said: "Glory be to Allah! Did Allah send down any disease on earth except that He made a cure for it?" Recorded by Ahmad with a Sahih chain.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 293 - (Sahih) "If there is good in any of your remedies, it is in these three: A drink of honey, a cupping incision, or cauterization with fire." Agreed upon. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, and Ahmad from the Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah (Marfu').

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 294 - (Sahih) From Uqbah bin Amir that he came in a group of ten riders to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. He accepted the pledge of allegiance from nine and withheld from one man. They said: "What is the matter with him?" He said: "There is a Tamimah (amulet) on his upper arm." The man cut the Tamimah, and the Messenger of Allah ﷺ accepted his pledge, then said: "Whoever hangs [an amulet] has committed Shirk." Sahih. Recorded by Ahmad and Al-Hakim, and the wording is his. Extracted in Al-Silsilah Al-Sahihah No. 492.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 295 - (Weak) "Whoever hangs a Tamimah (amulet), may Allah not complete it for him; and whoever hangs a Wada'ah (seashell), may Allah not leave him in peace." Weak. Recorded by Ahmad, Abu Ya'la, and Al-Hakim. Extracted in Al-Silsilah Al-Da'ifah No. 1266.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 296 - (Weak) From Imran bin Husayn that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saw a ring on a man's upper arm—I think he said of brass—so he said: "Woe to you, what is this?" He said: "It is for Al-Wahinah (a weakness/pain in the arm/shoulder)." He said: "Indeed it will not increase you except in weakness. Cast it off you, for indeed if you were to die while it is on you, you would never succeed." Weak. Recorded by Ahmad, Ibn Hibban, and Ibn Majah. Ibn Hibban does not have the phrase "if you were to die"; rather he has in a narration: "For indeed if you die while it is on you, you are entrusted to it." Extracted in Al-Silsilah Al-Da'ifah No. 1029.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 297 - (Hasan) From Isa bin Hamzah who said: I entered upon Abdullah bin Hakim and he had redness (Humrah), so I said: "Will you not hang a Tamimah?" He said: "We seek refuge in Allah from that." In a narration: "Death is closer than that. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Whoever hangs something is entrusted to it.'" Hasan. Recorded by At-Tirmidhi, Al-Hakim, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 298 - (Sahih) From Ibn Mas'ud, that he entered upon his wife and she had something knotted on her neck. He pulled it and cut it, then said: "The family of Abdullah have become rich enough not to associate with Allah that for which He sent down no authority." Then he said: "I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say: 'Indeed Ruqyah (incantations), Tamaim (amulets), and Tiwalah (love spells) are Shirk.'" They said: "O Abu Abdur-Rahman, we know Ruqyah and Tamaim, but what is Tiwalah?" He said: "Something women make to endear themselves to their husbands." Sahih. Recorded by Ibn Hibban and Al-Hakim. Extracted in Al-Silsilah Al-Sahihah No. 331.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 299 - (Sahih) It was narrated that Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) forbade his wife from such ignorant Ruqyahs. She said to him: "I went out one day and so-and-so saw me and my eye that was next to him began to tear (meaning it was affected by an evil envious eye). When I performed Ruqyah on it, the tearing stopped, and when I left it, it tore." Ibn Mas'ud said to her: "That is Satan; if you obey him, he leaves you alone, and if you disobey him, he pokes your eye with his finger. But if you had done as the Messenger of Allah ﷺ did, it would have been better for you and more conducive to healing: You sprinkle water in your eye and say: 'Remove the harm, O Lord of mankind, heal, You are the Healer, there is no healing but Your healing, a healing that leaves no illness.'" Sahih. Recorded by Ibn Majah, and the wording is his, and Abu Dawood in summary, and Al-Hakim briefer than them. It is the completion of the Hadith before it, No. 298.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 300 - (Hasan) "He is not of us who seeks omens or has omens sought for him, or predicts the future or has the future predicted for him, or performs magic or has magic performed for him." Recorded by At-Tabarani. The Hadith is Hasan due to supporting evidence (Li-ghayrihi).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 301 - (Weak) "'Iyafah (divination by flight of birds), Tiyarah (omens), and Tarq (divination by drawing lines) are from Jibt (sorcery/magic)." Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, and Ibn Hibban.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 302 - (Weak) "Three things no one is safe from: Suspicion, Omens, and Envy. If you suspect, do not verify; if you see an omen, do not turn back; and if you envy, do not transgress." At-Tabarani. Al-Albani said: I did not find anyone who mentioned it with this context from the Muhaddithin (Hadith scholars) or from the narration of At-Tabarani. Al-Haythami attributed it to him in Al-Majma' from the Hadith of Harithah bin An-Nu'man who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Three things are inseparable from my Ummah: Omens, Envy, and Suspicion." A man said: "What removes them, O Messenger of Allah, from those who have them?" He said: "If you envy, seek forgiveness from Allah; if you suspect, do not verify; and if you see an omen, do not proceed." It is weak... etc.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 303 - (Sahih) From Ibn Mas'ud that the Prophet ﷺ said: "Tiyarah (omens) is Shirk, Tiyarah is Shirk, Tiyarah is Shirk." Ibn Mas'ud said: "There is none among us but... however, Allah removes it with Tawakkul (reliance on Allah)." Abu Dawood and At-Tirmidhi. It is Sahih.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 304 - (Weak) "He is not of us who calls to 'Asabiyyah (tribalism/partisanship), and he is not of us who fights for 'Asabiyyah, and he is not of us who dies for 'Asabiyyah." Weak chain. Recorded by Abu Dawood and Ibn Adi... etc. However, the meaning of the Hadith is Sahih, for Muslim and others recorded from the Hadith of Abu Hurayrah: The Prophet ﷺ said: "Whoever leaves obedience and separates from the Jama'ah (community) and dies, dies a death of Jahiliyyah (ignorance). And whoever fights under a blind banner, getting angry for 'Asabiyyah, or calling to a partisan group, or supporting a partisan group, and is killed, his killing is that of Jahiliyyah." In a narration: "Then he is not of my Ummah."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 305 - (Weak) From Wathilah bin Al-Asqa' who said: I said: "O Messenger of Allah, what is 'Asabiyyah?" He said: "That you help your people in oppression." Weak. Recorded by Abu Dawood.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 306 - (Sahih) "Help your brother whether he is an oppressor or oppressed." They said: "O Messenger of Allah, this one we help when oppressed, but how do we help him when he is an oppressor?" He said: "You prevent him from oppression; that is helping him." Sahih. Recorded by Al-Bukhari. It is extracted in Irwa al-Ghalil.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 307 - (Sahih) Al-Bukhari narrated that Abu Dharr and Bilal Al-Habashi (may Allah be pleased with them) got angry with each other and traded insults. In the heat of anger, Abu Dharr said to Bilal: "O son of a black woman!" Bilal complained to the Prophet ﷺ, so the Prophet ﷺ said to Abu Dharr: "Did you shame him regarding his mother? Indeed you are a man in whom there is Jahiliyyah (ignorance)." Sahih with a context other than this. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, and Ahmad from Al-Ma'rur bin Suwayd who said: I saw Abu Dharr Al-Ghifari wearing a suit (Hullah), and his slave wearing a suit. We asked him about that, and he said: I abused a man and he complained about me to the Prophet ﷺ. The Prophet ﷺ said to me: "Did you shame him regarding his mother..." He added in the first place: "Indeed you are a man in whom there is Jahiliyyah." This is Al-Bukhari's wording.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 308 - (Hasan) From Abu Dharr that the Prophet ﷺ said to him: "Look! For indeed you are not better than a red man nor a black man except if you surpass him in piety (Taqwa) to Allah." Recorded by Ahmad. Its chain is weak, but it is supported and strengthened by the Hadith of Abu Sa'id who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Indeed your Lord is One and your father is One. There is no superiority for an Arab over a non-Arab, nor for a red man over a black man, except by piety." So it is Hasan.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 309 - (Hasan) "All of you are children of Adam, and Adam was created from dust." Hasan. Al-Haythami said: Recorded by Al-Bazzar from Hudhayfah, containing Al-Husayn Al-Urani who is weak. I say: But it is supported by the Hadith of Abu Sa'id mentioned just before and the Hadith of Abu Hurayrah coming next.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 310 - (Weak) "Indeed these lineages of yours are not a cause for reviling anyone. All of you are children of Adam... No one has superiority over another except by religion or piety." Recorded by Ahmad. Its chain is weak because of Ibn Lahi'ah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 311 - (Sahih) "People are children of Adam and Eve... Indeed Allah will not ask you about your lineages or ancestries on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed the most noble of you in the sight of Allah is the most pious of you." Sahih. Extracted in Al-Ahadith Al-Sahihah 1038.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 312 - (Hasan) "Let people cease boasting about their ancestors who have died—they are merely coal of Hell—or they will certainly be more insignificant to Allah than the beetle that rolls dung with its nose. Indeed Allah has removed from you the arrogance of Jahiliyyah and its boasting about ancestors. Indeed a person is either a pious believer or a miserable sinner. People are children of Adam, and Adam was created from dust." Hasan. Recorded by Abu Dawood, At-Tirmidhi, At-Tahawi, Al-Bayhaqi, Ahmad, Ibn Wahb, Ibn Mandah, and Abu Nu'aym.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 313 - (Sahih) "O people, indeed your Lord is One. Lo! There is no superiority for an Arab over a non-Arab (Ajam), nor for a non-Arab over an Arab, nor for a red man over a black man, nor for a black man over a red man, except by piety. (Indeed the most noble of you in the sight of Allah is the most pious of you)." Sahih. See the explanation.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 314 - (Sahih) "He is not of us who slaps his cheeks, rips his clothes (Juyub - chest openings), and calls out with the calls of Jahiliyyah (during mourning)." Sahih. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, and others from the Hadith of Abdullah bin Mas'ud. Extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 315 - (Sahih) From Zainab bint Abi Salamah that she narrated from Umm Habibah, the wife of the Prophet ﷺ, when her father Abu Sufyan bin Harb died, and from Zainab bint Jahsh when her brother died, that each of them called for perfume and touched some of it, then said: "By Allah, I have no need for perfume, except that I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say: 'It is not lawful for a woman who believes in Allah and the Last Day to mourn for a deceased person for more than three nights, except for a husband, [for whom she mourns] four months and ten days.'" Recorded by Al-Bukhari.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 316 - (Sahih) A woman came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and said: "My daughter's husband has died and she has a complaint in her eye; shall we apply Kohl to her?" The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "No," two or three times, saying "No" each time. Sahih. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, and Muslim and others recorded it. Extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 317 - (Sahih) "Indeed Allah and His Messenger have forbidden the sale of Khamr (wine), dead meat, swine, and idols." Agreed upon. In Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 318 - (Sahih) "Indeed, when Allah forbids a thing, He forbids its price." Sahih. It is from the Hadith of Ibn Abbas who said: I saw the Messenger of Allah ﷺ at the Corner (Rukn); he raised his gaze to the sky, laughed, and said: "Allah cursed the Jews" (three times). "Indeed Allah forbade fat for them, so they sold it and consumed its price. And indeed when Allah forbids..." Recorded by Abu Dawood, and the context is his, Ash-Shafi'i, Ahmad, Al-Daraqutni (the last sentence of it), and Al-Bayhaqi with a Sahih chain.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 319 - (Sahih) The Hadith forbidding the sale of Gharar (uncertainty) is in Sahih Muslim and others. Extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 320 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ forbade the sale of fruits until their ripeness appears (Badu Salah). Sahih. It is in the Two Sheikhs and others from the Hadith of Abdullah bin Umar. Extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 321 - (Sahih) He forbade the sale of ears of corn (or grain) until they turn white and are safe from blight. Sahih. Recorded by Muslim and others. Extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 322 - (Sahih) "Tell me if Allah withheld the fruit, with what right would one of you take his brother's money?" Sahih. Recorded by Al-Bukhari and Muslim. Extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 323 - (Sahih) Prices rose during his time ﷺ, so they said: "O Messenger of Allah, fix prices for us." He said: "Indeed Allah is the One who Fixes Prices, the Withholder, the Extender, the Provider. And indeed I hope to meet Allah while no one among you demands from me a grievance regarding blood or wealth." Sahih. Recorded by Abu Dawood, At-Tirmidhi, Ad-Darimi, Ibn Majah, Al-Bayhaqi, Ahmad, At-Tabarani, and Al-Diya' Al-Maqdisi.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 324 - (Weak) "Whoever hoards food for forty nights has disassociated himself from Allah, and Allah has disassociated Himself from him." Recorded by Ahmad, Al-Hakim, Ibn Abi Hatim, and Abu Nu'aym. The Hadith is weak, Munkar (denounced), and not Mahfuz (preserved); it is not good, nor is it fabricated.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 325 - (Sahih) "No one hoards except a sinner (Khati')." Sahih. Recorded by Muslim, as well as Abu Dawood, At-Tirmidhi, Ad-Darimi, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad. In a narration by Muslim and others: "Whoever hoards is a sinner."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 326 - (Weak) "Miserable is the servant who is a hoarder; if he hears of a price drop, it grieves him, and if he hears of a price rise, he rejoices." Weak. Recorded by At-Tabarani and others with a flimsy chain.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 327 - (Weak) "The importer is provided for (Marzuq), and the hoarder is cursed." Weak. Recorded by Ibn Majah, Al-Hakim, Ad-Darimi, Al-Bayhaqi, Abd bin Humayd, Al-Uqayli, and others.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 328 - (Weak) From Ma'qil bin Yasar who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say: "Whoever interferes in any of the prices of the Muslims to raise them against them, it is a right upon Allah Blessed and Almighty to seat him in a great place of Fire on the Day of Resurrection." He said: "Did you hear it from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ?" He said: "Not once or twice." Weak. Recorded by Ahmad and Al-Hakim.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 329 - (Sahih) Anas said: "We were forbidden that a town dweller should sell for a desert dweller, even if he is his brother by father and mother." Agreed upon. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, At-Tahawi, and Al-Bayhaqi.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 330 - (Sahih) "A town dweller should not sell for a desert dweller. Leave the people alone, Allah provides for some of them through others." Sahih. Recorded by Muslim, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, Ibn Majah, Ibn Al-Jarud, Ibn Abi Shaybah, At-Tahawi, Al-Tayalisi, and Ahmad.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 331 - (Sahih) Ibn Abbas was asked about the meaning of "A town dweller should not sell for a desert dweller." He said: "He should not be a broker (Simsar) for him." Sahih. Recorded by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, and Ahmad from Ibn Abbas who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Do not meet the riders (to buy goods before they reach the market) and a town dweller should not sell for a desert dweller." I said to Ibn Abbas: "What is his saying 'a town dweller should not sell for a desert dweller'?" He said: "He should not be a broker for him."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 332 - (Sahih) "Religion is Nasihah (Sincerity/Good Counsel)." Sahih. Recorded by Muslim, Abu Dawood, An-Nasa'i, and Ahmad. Al-Bukhari recorded it as Mu'allaq (suspended).

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 333 - (Hasan) "If one of you asks his brother for advice, let him advise him." Hasan. Recorded by Ahmad. In a narration: "Leave the people alone, some benefitting from others; but if one of you asks his brother for advice, let him advise him." In Sahih Muslim from the Hadith of Abu Hurayrah (Marfu'): "The rights of a Muslim upon a Muslim are six: If you meet him, greet him; if he invites you, accept it; if he asks you for advice, advise him; if he sneezes and praises Allah, bless him; if he falls ill, visit him; and if he dies, follow him (his funeral)."

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 335 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ forbade Najsh (bidding up the price without intention to buy). Agreed upon. Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Ahmad, and others from the Hadith of Ibn Umar. It is extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 336 - (Sahih) The Prophet ﷺ forbade meeting merchandise [caravans] before they reach the market. Authentic. Narrated by Muslim, Ahmad, and Ibn Majah. The wording is: 'The Messenger of Allah ﷺ forbade meeting imports (Jalab).' In another narration, he said: 'Selling takes place at the market of imports.' Its chain is also authentic.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram in Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wa al-Haram
text: 334 - (Sahih) "Muslims are bound by their conditions." Al-Bukhari (Mu'allaq). Recorded by Ahmad, Abu Dawood, Al-Hakim, and others as Mawsul (connected). It is Sahih and extracted in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 337 - (Sahih) That the Prophet ﷺ gave the owner of the commodity the option [to rescind] if he arrives at the market. Authentic. Narrated by Muslim from the Hadith of Abu Hurairah in Marfu' form: 'Do not meet imports. Whoever meets them and buys from them, then when its master comes to the market, he has the option.' It was also narrated by the authors of the Sunan and others, and it is in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 338 - (Sahih) He ﷺ said: 'The two parties to a transaction have the option (to cancel) as long as they have not separated. If they are truthful and clear, their transaction will be blessed, but if they lie and conceal, the blessing of their transaction will be wiped out.'

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 339 - (Sahih) 'It is not lawful for anyone to sell a commodity unless he clarifies what is in it, nor is it lawful for anyone who knows that to abstain from clarifying it.' Authentic, and it is in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 340 - (Sahih) The Messenger of Allah ﷺ passed by a man selling food (grain). He was impressed by it, so he put his hand inside it and felt wetness. He said: 'What is this, O owner of the food?' He said: 'The sky (rain) hit it.' He ﷺ said: 'Why did you not put it on top of the food so that people could see it? Whoever cheats us is not one of us.' Authentic. Narrated by Muslim from the Hadith of Abu Hurairah, and it is in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 341 - (Hasan) That he ﷺ passed by some food that its owner had made look good. He put his hand into it and found it to be bad food. He said: 'Sell this separately and this separately. Whoever cheats us is not one of us.' Hasan. It is from the Hadith of Abdullah bin Umar, and it is in Al-Irwa.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 342 - (Sahih) 'Swearing oaths sells the commodity but wipes out the blessing.' Authentic. Narrated by Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawood, Al-Nasa'i, and Ahmad from the Hadith of Abu Hurairah.

book_title: Ghayat al-Maram fi Takhrij Ahadith al-Halal wal-Haram
text: 343 - (Da'if) 'Whoever buys a stolen item while knowing it is stolen has shared in its sin and its shame.' Weak. Narrated by Al-Hakim in Al-Mustadrak, and from him Al-Bayhaqi in Al-Sunan Al-Kubra, and Abu Al-Qasim Al-Fadl bin Ja'far Al-Mu'adhin.
